Reviews.Title: “Really nice”
Reviews.Author: Mark A
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is a little dated this is made up for in a number of ways. Gret location ought on the creek with great views. Close to all the souks ( walking distance). Staff are great , polite, friendly and efficient-very good! The English pub downstairs is great as is the breakfast restaurant , good food, great service, great views. I've stayed here twice and am looking forward to the next time.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel right by the Creek”
Reviews.Author: jhlatl
Reviews.Content: This was one of the first five star hotels in the Middle East when it opened in 1985. In spite of its relative antiquity, and the proximity of many much more grandiose hotels, it remains an excellent option. The hotel is close to the old city and its souks and is right by the creek (for dhow cruises). For those looking for a city holiday with a bit of beach thrown it, there are arrangements in place to use the beach facilities at the Sheraton Jumeirah Beach. As a business hotel, it is of somewhat limited use as it is relatively far from most of the newer business districts, but its proximity to the airport makes it handy as a stopover on the way to or from other destinations. For Starwood Platinums there are lots of free extras including car transfers to and from the airport (e-mail or phone the hotel to arrange).

Reviews.Title: “I liked the location”
Reviews.Author: LongIslandRuss
Reviews.Content: Good spot on the Creek, a short walk from good shopping and Metro. Classy hotel, great staff. I had a great Creek View Room (a must get if you can) Overall a very good experience. Rooms were not great, old style bathroom, with shower in tub. There is a small outdoor pool, which was adequate, for hanging out or taking a dip.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight”
Reviews.Author: Helena181
Reviews.Content: We just stayed for 1 night before flying back to Malta. Hotel is lovely but location is not that ideal. There isn't much to do within walking distance. We hired a driver and had a 12 hour tour of the 'new' Dubai which was great!

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Very Poor Check In”
Reviews.Author: TartanSeagull
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in another 5* Hotel in Dubai a couple of years ago and I was expecting the same high standard of service... but I was left feeling very dissapointed. Myself & 2 colleagues arrived at approx 02:00 on the 19th Feb for just the 1 night. The lobby is on the ground floor & the reception on the 1st floor. Now whilst I dont want to sound all 'uppity', we had to take our own bags up the escalators to reception. We waited in a queue for 10 mins to check-in and at no time did anyone offer us water, juice, flannels etc. After we had finished checking in... I then had to ask...where are the lifts?, what time is breakfast?, what time is check-out? There were then no porters to take our bags up to our rooms. As I say I dont want to sound like a 'drama queen' and I am used to staying in hostels etc....... but when you pay 5* prices in a 5* Hotel you expect a standard of service....and we didnt receive that standard of service. The rooms itself was supurb, very large & clean with a great view of the creek, and there was a floor to ceiling window which slid open.... an excellent novelty, as most hotel rooms in Europe dont have windows that open. Breakfast was very good and then it was into Dubai for a few hours before check out. The hotel was ok, but 1st impressions count.....and ours wasnt good. Would I reccoment this hotel to others? Nope

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience when returning to an old favorite”
Reviews.Author: Oursdur
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing experience at this hotel. Being a SPG platinum member and having booked connecting rooms 3 weeks in advance it was a very unpleasant surprise to be informed at check in that "connecting rooms could not be booked in advance" or that there had been a "communication error". We ended up having two smoking rooms not close to each other. Management contacted the next day profusely apologized but we left the hotel nevertheless as this was not the first problem related to room allocation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, great views of Dubai Creek Area”
Reviews.Author: Dwyrwas
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bit older but still nice. We had a creek view room which was great, nice seeing the boats go by and the tall city buildings in the backround. Union Station Subway just around the corner. City Centre Shopping mall is very close. Only about 10 minutes from the Airport ($10.00 taxi ride). The taxis are not expensive and readily availablle. The Sheraton rooms are nice, outside pool is great. We had the breakfast buffet one morning which was great but a bit pricy (about $28.00/person). The internet in your room will cost you about $28.00 per day as well. The staff at the hotel were friendly but we had a few problems with our check out date, we had booked 3 nights but they kept callign us asking us when we were going to check out on the 2nd day. We had to explain to them 3 times that we had 3 nights paid.... a bit annoying. Overall the hotel is pretty good and I would stay there again. The Wild Wadi watrer park which was alot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great room for a quick stop over”
Reviews.Author: LittleJoPeep
Reviews.Content: Checked in for a quick stop over. I got a huge 2 room suite with two bathrooms. Very clean, quite luxurious, and all sorts of little extras like tootbrush, toothpaste, razor, etc. right in the room. I will definitely visit again, hopefully for longer than 6 hours.

Reviews.Title: “bit dated but doing all the right things”
Reviews.Author: OverworkedUnderpaid
Reviews.Content: Business trip for 5 days and as business was in the Deira area it seemed logical to stay nearby. I will be going back soon and I would definitely pick this hotel again for the sake of its location, though I know I am compromising on some of the glitzier opportunities available in town. The entrance is pretty grand but smells a bit musty. Overall impression here is good though, and all the restaurant/dining options are off this main hall. Check-in lacked charm but was entirely efficient (and they let me check in at 7 am so really can't complain at them at all on this point. What a relief!) Room - my room faced the road but was on a high floor as requested. I got a club room in fact. The room was nothing amazing but functional and comfortable - just a little bit dated. They did put me in a room right behind a lift shaft (my pet hate) but ear plugs did the trick. Or maybe it was just that I was so tired from flight/aircon/work etc! Bathroom rather dated and the fixed shower head is another pet hate. Rubbish for hair washing (girls will understand). Anyhow, everything worked and they had a couple of decent tv channels. Only slight complaint was that it was a bit cold! I called down for a robe and that took nearly 36 hours and 3 requests to materialise. They have since emailed me to apologise about this so I can honestly say that they take complaints seriously. Club lounge was a nice touch - I expected it to be more basic than it actually is (based on other reviews) - but service was friendly and really you can't underestimate the convenience of being able to pop in for a quick beer/snack on the way back up to your room after a long day in somebody elses office! Plenty of space. Could possibly do with a slightly darker/homier corner for relaxing - it is a bit airport lounge - but still, not bad. Also they will bring up coffee to your room if you order it the night before (not charged as room service). I thought that was a very nice touch. Though my room rate included breakfast I still chose to get my coffee here every morning - a fair selection of breakfast food and no wait whatsoever whereas the restaurant would have taken much longer to get seated/served I am sure. Food. I visited the pub once. It was very smoky and the football was very loud. Still I did get to see Thierry Henry score for Arsenal which was a sight I never thought I would see again. I ate every evening in the Italian restaurant. It was a bit cold for the terrace (and people smoke out there) but the view over the creek and skyline is very nice. You have to make the most of this as you aren't in town to see it all close up. Service was really sweet and attentive. Food was very good. I didn't visit the Indian or the Asian (which was a buffet on the night I did decide to try it). Gym. Good. 3 treadmills but only 2 in working order. 2 bikes. Quite a few weight machines and free weights. Only thing is that it is so humid in there. It is next to the saunas so that probably explains it. A very nice assistant showed me round the sauna/hammam facility on the morning I arrived - I did intend to use it but in the end I didn't have time. Pool. Bit chilly when I was there, and I got back too late to use it in the evenings. It has a very nice aspect right next to the creek and the boats so really quite a pleasant spot. So all in all really pretty good and I will definitely go back for business in the area. Though if business was in town then I would go elsewhere. The hotel is only about 10 mins from the airport so that is handy (especially if you have a 02h40 flight home like I did!) The hotel can organise a shuttle car to pick you up at the airport (I called them to ask about something else and they mentioned this by chance, so if you are booked into a club room and are a SPG guest then do give them a ring and request this service).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: rayd01
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton is located very near DXB and is only a about a $10 cab ride from the airport. Even with it's close proximity to the airport it is a great location. The hotel is located on Dubai creek and is located an easy drive and walk from some great restaurants, shopping malls and tourist sights. If you are a Platinum SPG member there is a great lounge located in the lobby that offers free adult beverages and snacks for a couple of hours in the evening and a continental breakfast in the mornings. There is a pretty good gym that has a couple of treadmills and elipticals along with some free weights and machines. The treadmills have an integrated TV so take your earbuds with you. There is also a very nice pool located next to the gym. Be sure to ask for a room facing the Creek so you can take advantage of the amazing views of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service ever - personnel unfriendly, service-averse, incompetent”
Reviews.Author: ZOC888
Reviews.Content: Complete lack of service is visibly due to an overall attitude issue of the personnel engaged with only very few positive exceptions such as concierge and head-waiter at breakfast. Sorry to say, but service is one of the very few key criteria that allows one top address to differentiate from another and managing corporate culture is always the GM's task. Despite of providing our flight details as part of our reservation I had to write an extra email to receive a confirmation for the pick-up service included in our rate. Upon arrival the driver was not there. He only showed up 15' after my reminder call to the hotel (takes about 15' from the hotel to the airport). We queued at the reception only to see the receptionist get up and disappear for good when it finally was our turn w/o as much as a glance, greeting or apology. The next receptionist took 20' to get us checked in - despite of all personal details being provided as part of our online reservation and readily available in the system - and commented while handing us the key cards for the reserved club floor room overlooking the creek 'do you mind if there's drilling and hammering next to your room, we are remodelling our top floors?' Yes, surprisingly we did mind with the result that 10' later and after a few phone calls she down graded us to the 4th floor - w/o a word of apology (and quite naturally at the inital rate). This did not hinder the very same receptionist upon check-out to deduct an unauthorized donation from our bill. Well, this was certainly our first, last and only stay there.

Reviews.Title: “What a dichotomy!”
Reviews.Author: Douglas A
Reviews.Content: One cannot help but being impressed upon entering this hotel - what a grand lobby! I was attending a conference that was being held here and arrived about 01.30 in the morning. The hotel sent a car and driver to pick me up at the airport; I was tired but greeted warmly and efficiently at check in and promptly ushered to my room on the club floor. The room was was adequate and what I expected - nicely decorated and comfortable. I was absolutely impressed during my stay with the staff. Everywhere I went, I was greeted by name or with a timely felicitation. All professionals - all engaged. And all seemed to enjoy their jobs. And I would give the hotel a five star rating except for the following. 1) Your beds are soft and so are your pillows. 2) Not that I'm a TV addict - I rarely watch it but when I'm traveling I like to tune into news channels. But my television did not work. They had a special channel for SPG guests; all I got was snow. 3) The food and beverage manager doesn't get it. Being an agribusiness consultant and taking food processors to market, I happen to be abreast of food trends. And I know that healthy lifestyle foods are gaining a lot of traction worldwide. Given SPG (Starwood Preferred Guest) treatment, I went to the Club Lounge the next morning for breakfast and found a diabetic's worst nightmare - nothing here I could really eat to satisfy myself. So I skipped breakfast after nibbling on some olives. The conference - organized by a group from Singapore - was poorly managed in terms of time and still had not adjourned for lunch by 13.30. Having skipped breakfast I had to get something to eat so I went to the restaurant off the lobby. Again, a diabetic nightmare. The next morning, having learned my lesson at the Club Lounge, I went back to the lobby restaurant to see if the food and beverage manager could improve his offerings for a healthy breakfast. I was greeted with French toast, noodles (noodles?), chicken teriyaki, choices of breads, fried potatoes, etc. I did manage to get some baked beans, a grilled tomato, a bowl of fruit and a probiotic yogurt. Really, your F&B manager should know that the prevalence of diabetes among citizens of the UAE is the second highest in the entire world. Between that and the fact that some people just like to have a healthy meal should compel him/her to doing a much better job of diversifying the menu. 4) Managing a regional office, I need to stay in touch. Cell phone and SMS messages are not enough. I need to review documents prior to presentations or submittal and I need to communicate thoughts in writing that exceed short SMS strictures. And twice a month I need to approve electronic time sheets. So here was my greatest disappointment about this hotel. I simply was unable to take advantage of the "high speed network" that they touted in their reservation acknowledgement. My room was hard wired with an Internet cable but pages wouldn't load. I finally called the front desk and they sent a technician. I asked him what the speed was supposed to be and he responded 100mbps. I told him it was more like 100kbps. That failed. I then took my laptop to the lobby to see if I could connect on WiFi - marginally better but still took me 11 minutes to download a 1.2MB document. So in order to approve electronic time sheets that simply were not opening in my room (hardwired cable!) or on WiFi in the lobby, I paid a visit to the business center. Really not much better but I accomplished my objective. Later in the conference I was talking to a European executive and we agreed to exchange e-mails, but I told him it would have to wait until I got back to Cairo as the Internet was problematical in the hotel. He agreed, saying it was "rubbish." So there you have it. All during my stay I kept hearing about $6 billion in enhancements to the chain. Here's my recommendation: spend a few thousand more dollars on a server and a decent ISP so you can accommodate your business guests. Otherwise, keep serving those breakfast noodles to your Japanese tourist guests, because I won't be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service”
Reviews.Author: lulu-cs
Reviews.Content: Given the price, the service we received was dreadful. The staff were rude and abrupt. The Sheraton preferred guest rooms were not stocked with the items promised. When we asked for directions to nearby landmarks, we were not advised that the distance and confusing street layout made it advisable to take a taxi. There were, however, two major problems that made the stay memorable, if only for how terrible it was. Firstly, breakfast. We arrived well within advertised breakfast hours, and had paid to have the price of breakfast included. Upon arrival, we were told we would be "lucky" to get a table before service closed, and some people had been waiting for up to half an hour. We did eventually get a seat, and I will admit the breakfast was good. Secondly - the noise. We had the misfortune of staying on New Years Eve. The party in the lobby was unreasonably loud. I expect noise on New Years Eve - I do not expect to be able to hear it all clearly on the tenth floor. I also did not expect to have to endure drunken idiots trying to access my room, unaware it was not their own.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good stay”
Reviews.Author: joshr911
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 2 nights at this hotel. First off, it is located in a good area, right on the Creek. We paid around $300/night for a King bed with a creek view. Well, we did get all of that. But, we were put in a wheel chair accessible room. The room itself was fine, but the bathroom is where we had some issues. The shower was meant to accommodate a wheel chair, so it was just a curtain and a shower head. The shower head was at about armpit level on me, so it was a bit difficult to shower. Not only that, when you turned on the shower, the entire bathroom flooded. The shower was not separated from the remaining portion of the bathroom at all. The drainage was so inadequate that there would be about an inch or two of standing water on the floor and it would spill out into the room. When we went down to ask for another room, we were offered a city view with 2 double beds. The other option was for housekeeping to come mop the floor after each shower! Since we did not want to downgrade our room, we chose to have housekeeping mop the floor. Figured we would at least make them do some work. We also asked for a non slip mat for the bathroom (the floors were all marble and quite slippery). We asked a few times and never received it. When we checked out, I again complained about our room and was just met with a smile and a nod. No one seemed to care. Also, when you stay at a Sheraton, you usually get the nice Sheraton pillows. Well, not in our room. My wife and I each used two pillows and they were paper thin. For the amount of money that was spent to stay at this hotel, there are far better choices in Dubai. I will not stay at this hotel again, even though I am an SPG member.

Reviews.Title: “needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: reneemarbella
Reviews.Content: Well located if you want to be near the market. The rooms are nice but the hotel needs serious renovation! Taking a shower can be quite an adventure, bacause, as the pipes are so old, you can get a fast change in temperature, that can really burn you.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for short stay”
Reviews.Author: JenGNotts
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel if you are in Dubai just for a couple of nights as a stop over.It is literally 5 mins from the airport so it made our three night stop over en route to South Africa really convenient and a relaxing start to the holiday.The Creek area is not the most bustling of the four main tourist areas (Dubai Creek,Dubai city centre,Jumeirah,Dubai marina) but it has the charm of the river and the souks which we enjoyed. Breakfast was excellent and the outside terrace tables looking over the creek were very special.We had a club room and this made all the difference.We made the most of the drinks which were available all day and then happy hour 6.30 til 8 when there was unlimited alcoholic drinks and lots of hot and cold nibbles.The nibbles were so substantial one night that we didn't bother with dinner!!! In terms of things to do,we used the metro to get around which was £5 for a day pass and a really good system-sparkling clean and safe!We went to the water park at the palm,jumeirah,which was overpriced but amazing fun,so worth it in my opinion (but get there early-we were there for opening and didn't queue for anything.at about 2pm it seemed everyone else turned up So we headed home!). Overall a very enjoyable stay but not in the heart of the action.if you want that, stay in Dubai city centre by the Dubai mall and Burg Kalifa.

Reviews.Title: “not impressed at all”
Reviews.Author: Alexdip
Reviews.Content: I did not go through TA reviews before booking. Only checked this site before my arrival and I did not expect much., Surprisingly on arrival I've had a nice impression. Lobby was large and well kept, staff very kind and everything went smooth, not the quickest check in honestly but smooth. They offered an upgrade with my room which I refused because I wanted to keep my creek view room, but the gesture was kind. Room was large , lovely view over the creek and pretty comfortable. The hotel is old, yes it is. And the room decor is old, but not tired. All is perfectly kept and does not look like its age, if not for the fack that no one would probably ever chose this type of furniture for a house today. The first impresison was really ggod and thought TA reviews were misleading. But it was not...The service turned out to be slow, queing for breakfast because tables are not prepared is something you could not expect. The big problem was the hotel is understaffed and the actual staff is willing but not necessarily trained enough. Just an example: in 7 days staying I've always seen the same 3 people at the reception desk. Morning, evening or night it's always the 3 of them. The pool was a disaster...after 2 days we got a notice to say it have to go under a small maintenance and that they'd kept it close for 8 hrs the following day...when we left, 5 days later, it was still closed. Worst thing is that we never got any apology letter from the staff. The gym indeed was nice, not big but pretty decent. A good remark for the resataurant, good asian food but moslty loved the Indian restaurant. Really great food and etremely caring service. In spite all of the above I do not feel like giving a totally negative review on the place. It is actually worm, welcoming and cozy, you'd feel like home quite easily and the location over the creek is really a plus. Nevertheless it is far below the average quality of the hotel you find in Dubai, this is certain. My suggestion is, if you grab a good rate and are not looking for a beach hotel, just give it a chance. Otherwise there are far better options.

Reviews.Title: “Confusing service”
Reviews.Author: Vallyty
Reviews.Content: Dubai is a very modern city with many new and stylish hotels. Sheraton Dubai Creek is an old hotel with unmodern rooms. I arrived late to the hotel due to flight delays. Eleven hours before check out time for my first night I called the hotel to inform about my very late check in. I also sent an e-mail in the morning. The hotel replyed quickly via e-mail that my new arrival time was registered. Three hours later a woman from Sheraton Dubai Creek called me and asked about my reservation. I told her that I was delayed, and she got my new arrival information. Later I received an e-mail from Sheraton Dubai Creek telling me that my credit card had been charged for no show for the entire stay. At check in I was told that I had been upgraded to a suite. But the room I got was not a suite. I appreciated the nice view of Burj Khalifa and Dubai Creek from my room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and just a taxi ride away from most things”
Reviews.Author: welltravelledsue
Reviews.Content: I always stay here when in Dubai as its a lovely hotel and everything is great, I usually have a suite, room number 1101 on the preferred floor which is the top floor and the views are to die for, there is a massive bed, desk area and sofa and chairs, with great sliding doors which can open out and let the breeze in, you overlook the Creek and can see for miles with the Burj Al Arab Hotel in the distance. The service in all areas are great, food is excellent, there is nothing bad I can say. I have held several sales conferences here and its all been as I requested. As its on the creek, its nice to stroll in the early morning or evening along the front, maybe stop for a tea or coffee along the way. If you wish to go to Bur Dubai just hop on a Dow which takes you across the Creek and you in the heart of the shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: ismailm08
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights in December 2011 and had a great tiem at the Sheraton. The hotel has a nice feel to it and the location is perfect. It is a 15 minute walk to the Deira City Centre and getting a taxi is easy. The rooms are a bit old for a 5 star hotel but well looked after and very spacious. Our room had a good view of the creek which was nice in the mornings. The hotel staff are very accomodating and friendly especially at the front desk. We would definitely stay here again if we were looking to stay near the creek or Deira.

Reviews.Title: “Think again.....”
Reviews.Author: Abcmfield
Reviews.Content: I won't go into detail but other than eating at Ashiana I would strongly suggest considering elsewhere in Dubai to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Old and Worn”
Reviews.Author: cornelia007
Reviews.Content: Celebrated New Year in Dubai and stayed in Sheraton Dubai Creek. The Hotel is right on the Creek and quite close to the Gold and Spice Souk. This is far away from the Center of Dubai of the Shopping Malls and Jumeriah Beach but it is close to the airport and the Local atmosphere so it depends on what you are looking for. However, the Hotel itself is like stepping into Back to the Future and seeing an old 80´s Hotel. Hotel is worn and tired and the Staff are slow and inefficient. Especially the Club Lounge need to reconsider a better system by having self service of drinks and bring food out much quicker.However, I will say this, the Japanese Restaurant " Creek Side " have the Best Seafood Buffet I have ever experienced. Amazing and Thank You to you all for making our Holiday and New Year.

Reviews.Title: “Both great and not so.....”
Reviews.Author: Magnus K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice in Dec., both before and after we took the Costa Favolosa Christmas cruise from Dubai. We stayed here because everything else was fully booked. It is a mixed review with some "great" things and some "not". Smooth check-in, not the same for the check-out though, so don't be overly time optimistic if you have an early flight. The rooms are a bit old fashioned, but still clean and neat. The second time we got a room with a beautiful river view.  The bathrooms are also old fashioned in marble, but clean and nice. However the showers are not working correctly, one second you are skulled hot and a few minutes later it gets cold. I called the guest services about it and I was told that it was probably because they were doing some renovation on some floors.  Positives: We celebrated new years eve at the hotel, possibly the best buffet I have had ever and I have tried a lot. The hotel has three restaurants; Italian, Indian and Sushi. All three of them had open buffet, so that you could go to any one you like. The food was absolutely "amazing". The service and attention was also awesome, especially the restaurant managers. Even though they had a full house they took the time to locate grapes for the Spanish in our group that has the tradition to eat 12 grapes at the twelve "strokes" at midnight on new years eve. Photo with chef Ruben. They also had live entertainment.   The breakfast buffet in the vivaldi restaurant was really great as well.  The hotel has a small pool, nothing special. Very friendly staff, especially the restaurants personnel and the bell boys. Negatives: The in-room dining service experience was not as good. The first night we asked for fish-n-chips, and both my daughter and I got sick. At our second stay we asked for club sandwich that was ok, but it took more than 36 minutes. I mention this because the hotel promise if in-room dining is not served in 30 min or less it's free, but they still argued they did and charged for it. "Don't promise what you can't keep".

Reviews.Title: “Sylvia Bates (Crete)”
Reviews.Author: Sylvia B
Reviews.Content: We had our first trip to Dubai to celebrate our Golden Wedding when we arrived they upgraded us to a club creek room the view was stunning.The rooms were cleaned every day with clean bedding and towels. The service from the staff was excellent from reception to restaurant and bars also the food was superb. The Christmas Brunch was out of this world every dish you could think of and excellent value for money. We are hoping to back for next Christmas and hope we are able to stay there again as it was place we felt comfortable in.

Reviews.Title: “Many better options in Dubai for the price”
Reviews.Author: TravlChick
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business in a club lounge room. Not nearly as good as most business class hotels in Dubai for the same price. Club lounge isn't on club floors, it is in lobby - not very convenient, and not open very early. Gym has 3 ellipticals, some treadmills, a few weight machines. Room was rather small for a UAE room and nothing special. Breakfast was a good buffet but again not special for a UAE hotel. Location not near anything other than being on Dubai Creek - and a difficult traffic pattern to get into hotel. Hotel website and photography makes it look much nicer than it is. Indian restaurant in hotel is quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay in this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: larisrunner
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel lied. The hotel was filthy in places. It also took 3 or 4 phone calls to reception to get anything done. **Filthy** Several places were very filthy. The entire area around the pool looked clean at first but your feet, clothes and bags were covered in filthy black dirt if they ever touched the surface. The baby cot we had in our room was also filthy and covered in dried blood amongst other things. It took us ages to clean it properly. **Liars** We booked our hotel over the phone. I spoke with a reservations person at the hotel who assured me that we could use an Expedia voucher when we checked in. I wrote to the hotel immediately after this phone call to confirm these details. When we arrived all the check in staff denied any knowledge of this and said it was not possible. I even gave the name of the reservations person I spoke to but they denied this person existed and said they cannot accept vouchers. We were also told at the breakfast restaurant that our breakfast was complimentary. Upon checkout it was revealed that it was not. **Slow Service** Every time we made a minor request for something from our room we had to wait an age for it to be actioned and had to call several times. **The Good Points** The pool staff were very nice. The room was nice. **Summary** There are much nicer, cleaner places to stay in Dubai. Shop around.

Reviews.Title: “There are better places to stay in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Brian W
Reviews.Content: I'm a Platinum member of Starwood, and have had some fantastic travel experiences at Starwood properties around the world. Unfortunately the Sheraton Dubai Creek was not one of these. I had high hopes for this property given the reviews on here and the fact that Dubai has a reputation for top notch service. However, I was entirely underwhelmed by the experience and moved hotels in the middle of my stay. What was wrong?: - Front desk staff was cold at check-in, and made a point of mentioning how since we were on a discounted rate we could not get an upgrade. They could have just said there was nothing available - There was a scheduled power outage overnight that we were not told of when we made the reservation. As a result the emergency light in our room was on all night and we couldn't fall asleep, especially given our jet lag - The morning after we checked in they tore up the carpeting on the floor so coming to our room in the normally dark halls was unpleasant - The room looked like it hadn't been upgraded since the mid 1980s - The included breakfast in the club lounge was minimal and service again was cold Granted the public areas were very nice, but we paid for comfortable night sleeps in our room which we did not receive. For our last night in Dubai we stayed at the Four Points Bur Dubai, which was great and would highly recommend. We wish we had stayed there for the entire time, and hadn't been influenced to stay here by the Sheraton brand.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: Alexandretta
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in November 2011, during a business trip in Dubai. It is true that this hotel is older than most of the hotels in Dubai, that are located in modern buildings and have impressive lobbies and restaurants and modern furniture, however, it is a very nice hotel and from some aspects, I personally like it better than some of the newly built hotel. First of all, it is beautifully located upon the Dubai Creek, with lovely views. You can have your breakfast / lunch in the beautiful Vivaldi restaurant, sit out on the terrace and spent a lovely time by the Creek, watching the dhows and abras. For me, this was my favorite part of this hotel - while in other hotels in Dubai, you always have to sit inside, in luxury, but air conditioned rooms, with no view. My room was facing the main avenue upon which the hotel is, and on the first night I had an issue with the noise from the traffic - probably others would not find it annoying, but I am a light sleeper. A pair of ear plugs and the problem was solved. I think if you get a Creek view room you will not have a problem - plus the views are amazing, you can see all the way to Burj Khalifa and other big skyscrapers in Dubai center. The room was huge, nicely decorated, spotless. Had a fully stocked minibar, but everyday we had 2 coplimentary bottles of mineral water placed in our room. We were welcomed by a plate of local fruits, and there was also a kettle with a selection of coffees and teas. The cleaning staff was exceptional, very discrete, and they were replenishing each day the bathroom amenities. Very comfortable bed, nice big bathroom. About the internet, it is true there is no wifi in the rooms, however, in the end for me it was better as the connection speed with the wire was better and was not interrupted, as it happens some times with the wifi. Also, i have never been to a 5 star hotel where the internet is not charged. I asked people who stayed in other hotels in Dubai, and they all had to pay extra for the internet. The only times when i did not have to pay extra, was when there was an agreement prior to the booking between the hotel and the agency, to include the internet in the pre agreed rate. Breakfast was very nice, with a big selection of local and international food. We also had lunch in Vivaldi's terrace, they had an italian buffet, and it was very nice and tasty. We also had a few drinks in Chelsea Arms pub - nice decor and atmosphere. There is also a souvenir shop, a hair salon, a shop with carpets, a shop with jewelry and a spa - i just visited the hair salon, service was very good. We had some meetings at the hotel, the business center was very good and the people working there very helpful. One of the biggest advantages of this hotel is the staff - they are all very helpful, quick and friendly. Overall, it was a very nice experience and i would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming staff offer professional and polite service and great location for business and short stay trips”
Reviews.Author: CJMarbella
Reviews.Content: Had a very pleasant stay here and it made a great base for moving around Dubai and just 15 mins from the airport. Check-in was quick and efficient and was made to feel welcome after long flight. Had booked a club exec room which includes private car transfers to and from the airport so saves you time and gives that extra level of service. As a Starwood member I was also fortunate to be given a free room upgrade and had super views over the Dubai Creek with the magnificent skyline of the Burj Kalifa as a backdrop. This is a business hotel, rather than a rssort style ones that you find near the Palm and Marina, but it has a nice pool for a relaxing swim and the Vivaldi Restaurant offers a good Italian menu, the staff gave excellent service and you can also dine on the outside terrace with views over the creek. Hotel also offers indian and japanese restaurants and in the magnificent lobby you'll find a pleasant coffee bar and nice area to relax in. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing - not a real SPG hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bld-1712
Reviews.Content: I tried this hotel because intercontinental and plaza were fully booked due to Dubai Air Show... This will be my first and last stay there. Service was terrible ! Not a 5-star at all I waited 45 min at breakfast to get two fried eggs. I was awaken at 2 am by the cleaning guys in the room next door, who were hoovering and getting the room ready. When I asked them to stop, they just told me they can't because the hotel was full and they had early arrivals in the morning. There were works in other rooms on the same floor starting early in the morning. On departure, the concierge insisted that I took their private driver to go to the airport, instead of a normal taxi for 40 dirhams when the normal price is 15-20 dirham with a normal taxi (whic I knew so I refused the driver, but the concierge insisted I was wrong and that 40 was the normal price) And I could go on ...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: partagas92
Reviews.Content: This become a ritual for me. First and last night in Dubai always take place in this hotel. Excellent business hotel, idealy located close by the airport, it allows travelers to reach hotel or airport fast from thier travel. Nice atmospher, close by souks, with super view on the creek, this hotel is particullary apropriate for business or leisure if you have to deal or visit old Dubai. Good service, it has not the extravagence of the other hotel, but has a cosy atmospher. Prices are attractive, and there is a superb Japonese restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “A nVery nice older property”
Reviews.Author: Fazzone
Reviews.Content: I am not usually a Sheraton guy but I tried this hotel on a recent visit to Dubai. The property is a little dated and isn't really nearby to anything. But, if you need a hotel that is easy to get to from the airport, is clean, works well, has a good restaurant choice and is quiet, you will like this one. One downside, no in room wifi. You have to be in the lobby for it to work which was a real inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: molsign1804
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the way back from the Maldives but in hindsight wich we had just gone straight home and not bothered. First impressions were good, impressive lobby and check in. We asked if we could upgrade our room as had booked a standard room with expedia. So we paid to upgrade to a club room which provided us with breakfast/club lounge access and airport transport. We were shown our room and refused it. It was on the 2nd floor, old, tatty and noisy above the lobby. I asked why it wasnt on the club floor as just paid the upgrade? Apparently because of the noise from the building work We then realised that our daughter couldnt use the club Lounge with us after 5pm as they served Alchohol, so decided really if the Club floors were noisy and we couldnt enjoy the club room in the evening then there wasnt any point paying the upgrade, so we downgraded back to our City basic room! As we preferred a king room then the wait would be 4 hours, fine we went for an early dinner and pid £60 for 3 burgers and 3 drinks! We were kindly bought our key, we had been allocated a room on the club floor, with a creek view?? We werent going to complain. It was a better standard room and we hadnt paid for it?? The rooms in general are ok, just ok, 2 nights was fine but hate the fact you cant open any windows or doors. We called and asked for an extra bed for my daughter aged 7 as we had booked for 2 adults & 1 child. it didnt arrrive so on the way out for an evening stroll we asked again. We came back at 8pm, with a tired girl in tow, still no bed. We called and were told we would have to pay for one,they wanted £100 per night. We refused and one appeared about an hour later. Very very frustating. We were missing a cork screw in our room and one hour later they bought 2! We had a lovely meal in the hotel with a view over Dubai Creek, service and food excellent. However couldnt wait to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Stay”
Reviews.Author: sheratondamas
Reviews.Content: i stayed in Sheraton Creek the whole week of Eid, it was amazing vacation, although i was abit scared as the hotel is aged comparing to other Hotels in Dubai, but once i checked in my fears gone a way as it is perfectly kept and maintained with comfortable atmosphere, quick service, top cleanliness and great view from our bed room at the creek specially the fire works which they used to do in the evening for the Union Anniversary. and i will not close my review without telling you about the SPA services and the massage treatment given by Ms.Tsyranya (forgive my misspelling if did) which take you to another world. i advice every one to stay there, Good Luck Alia

Reviews.Title: “Old Property, needs refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: udaypilani
Reviews.Content: A disappointment really, having read excellent reviews I was expecting better. The location is good and so are the restaurant and food quality however the rooms need uplifting considering the price and other options available at that pricing.

Reviews.Title: “The Place to Stay in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: PAQ
Reviews.Content: I had original booked and stayed 2 nights at the Four Points by Sheraton Sheik Fayed Road. That was no good at all. Thankfully, I switched to this hotel. Even though more expensive, worth every penny. First, it is in the very interesting Dubai Creek area, so beautiful views and easy walking to the souks. The hotel is beautiful and large. Huge lobby area with plenty of places to sit and relax and listen in the evening to piano player or the water fountain. Nice outdoor pool and fitness center. Check in desks are really disks and you sit in the chairs relaxing while you check in. Elevators move quickly. Club lounge was the real deal. Breakfast cold and hot food and same in the evening. Plenty of drinks, and 2 persons to serve you as well. TV and lots of magazines and newspapers, plus comfortable and plentiful couches, chairs, and tables, as you desire. One of the top 5 Starwood club lounges I have ever seen (and that is of over 100). 2 free computers with printer available. As a Platinum SPG Member, I was upgraded to a room with wonderful view of the creek and downtown Dubai. 8th floor was entirely quiet. Heavenly bed was its usual superb. Bathroom was modern although I prefer a shower rather than a shower in a bathtub. Lots of closet room and AC worked perfectly. SOOOO glad I selected this hotel. It is only 10 minutes from the center of Dubai by taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Sheraton Dubai Creek (and don't miss the food!)”
Reviews.Author: scterminator
Reviews.Content: Great stay at Sheraton Dubai Creek recently. Nice location and easy taxi ride to center of Dubai, the airport, and more. Great staff that makes this hotel a favorite in all of the Gulf. The food at Creekside Japanese restaurant is amazing and a great value. Ashiana continues to be my favorite Indian food restaurant in the world. Great value, clean rooms, considerate staff; great job!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Ullans
Reviews.Content: Although this is, overall, a very good hotel, why is there no wifi in the rooms (in this day and age?!). That said, the Creek view rooms are hard to beat. The hotel is also well located for Baniyas water bus station and Union metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a stop-over...”
Reviews.Author: fhgarib
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel only because the person whom i was supposed to meet was going to stay here.. and since i was in dubai for only a day, staying at the same hotel suited me... otherwise it is an ok hotel close to the airport but away from most attractions...

Reviews.Title: “One of Dubai's 'older' hotels that ages gracefully.”
Reviews.Author: BenPrairies
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Dubai goes back to 1990. Have tried a few hotel in the city (on Sheik Zayed road - Fairmont, Shangri-La, Emirates Towers, Crowne Plaza) and decided to give the Sheraton Dubai Creek another try. I was not disappointed. By Dubai standards, it is an older hotel but one that retains a classic feel. Impeccable service, large Club room and centrally located. Get a room with a view of the Creek. An evening stroll along the Creek, steps away from the hotel is a highlight. Excellent choice of restaurants. Decently sized exercise room and pool. Breakfast overlooking the Creek is great. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “good standard with no surprises”
Reviews.Author: heiron
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice for several nights this summer. The lobby is quite nice and the most up to date part of the hotel. The pool is very small and not made to spend longer times there as it has no plants around or any positive atmosphere. Good to use to swim in the morning after workout in the gym but not to relax. The rooms are a little bit outdated, but clean to the Sheraton standards. They are starting renovations and will obviously close the hotel for some months next year. High floor rooms facing the creek allow a nice view especially in the evening. If you have a layover and mainly need a high standard bed and shower it is a recomendable hotel as it is close to the old Dubai and to the airport. Only benefit for SPG plats is the lounge access, which is fine and offers the lounge basics. For breakfast you can also use the main restaurant, which is for sure the better choice as lounge breakfast is reduced. They will also provode most of the food like eggs etc there but the bring it from the main restaurant. So if you do not have a breakfast meeting you can go there directly to save time.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Place”
Reviews.Author: Anton G
Reviews.Content: Do not even doubt about that one. I have stayed in a few hotels in Dubai, I was in Premier Inn *, Was at Rotana Rose, but Sheraton Creek cannot stand close to them. Very clean, comfortable, pleasant to sleep and enjoy stay. Staff is friendly. I had problems with reservations from Company who failed to book me 1st night (flight was changed on an earlier one), there was no problem, they just settled me for free. Room is huge, view on Creek if amazing. Furniture is brand new but very convenient. Breakfast was various and full. Do not hesitate to stay there. I will be there 12-15 October 2011 and really expecting to come there again. Another huge plus is sport club, it is really worth visiting - nive, light gym with good equipment, pretty and cosy pool, resting areas and steam room, wadrobes, showers - everything is excellent. I left the hotel sport club like just born again. Recommended for business trips and couples in vacations. Family would be also good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Dubai hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mcourt123
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights last week and enjoyed every moment of it, very nice hotel in good location, great attentive staff, could nt fault it, will definitely be returning there as soon as I can.

Reviews.Title: “Very good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: RitzB
Reviews.Content: It was my first time to stay at Sheraton Dubai Creek (I have been to Dubai several times as I live in the Middle East), and we stayed 2 nights on the club floor, which was arranged by my husband's company for his business meeting. I was told that this hotel was about 20 years old, but it wasn't at all as tired as I imagined. The creek view from the window was wonderful, the access to the club lounge was fantastic, and the complementary breakfast and the view from the restaurant was great. The staff was helpful and the service was very great. The things I was a little disappointed were that the bathroom amenities was not in high standard (No toothbrush, no cottonbuds, no sawing kit... ) and there were no WIFI in the room (only in the lobby and the business lounge). Business hotels like here should have these amenities and the service at least. It was a great stay for me, and I think it is a very good hotel for business people.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel, minimal improvements required to make stay perfect”
Reviews.Author: Emily_Ruth2
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights on the club floor with creek view rooms... well worth paying the small amount extra. We had transfers in luxury cars included, amazing breakfast buffet overlooking the creek each morning... and access to the club lounge with free refreshments. They remembered we were honeymooners and on the first night had a 'celebration' cake left in our room. The room and bed was comfortable and clean (important!), but not as "shiny" as I was expecting. My only criticism is that there never seemed to be enough staff on duty in the lounge, restaurant &c... sometimes longer waits resulted. Otherwise it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent view but a little tired.”
Reviews.Author: JeffreyLA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July on business because my company has a discounted rate at this hotel. When I checked in, they did not have the type of room I had reserved, namely a king-bedded, creek-view one. The only creek-view room they had had two queens. And they didn't even have an SPG room avaialable. I don't understand it because the hotel seemed fairly empty. Not the worst thing in the world but I was hoping to at least be upgraded to the club levels or offered free breakfast because of it. None of that was offered. This was the only time service wasn't great. The hotel staff (other than the person at check-in) was very courteous and friendly. I especially liked all the dining staff from the breakfast waiters/waitresses to the attendants in the lobby cafe. The view from my room was truly magnificent! You could see the entire creek and watch the dows (wooden boats) parade up and down. You could even see the Burj Khalifa which is the tallest structre in the world. Only thing that would have been better is if the sliding glass door could open. They have it all locked up which is a shame. The hotel and the room were a little dated and tired but one has to remember that it is almost 20 years old and one of the first luxury hotels built in Dubai. Long before all the hoopla and building boom of the recent years. Still, I think Sheraton needs to update it. Perhaps the club level rooms are nicer.

Reviews.Title: “good travel and will come back”
Reviews.Author: franckz
Reviews.Content: The hotel and the staff was so nice with us. Special thanks to the people from the front office at the check in and check out, very helpful and so nice and kind with our son, Adam The room was nice and clean, During our stay, the service was so good. The restaurant and breakfast buffer so amazing choice and variety of dishes. Thanks to the chef. Special thanks to one Employee, who bring back, the diamond ring of my wife who let him in the Toilet. Thanks again for the honesty .... Appreciate so much. We will come back again in our next trip to UAE

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, just not a fan of Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Lozeves
Reviews.Content: This hotel is stunning, however I find Dubai awful, why... Dirty on the streets if you venture out... Us English tend to do the tourist options of which are all very well kept, however I like to have a good nose... It did not feel safe, but if you like nice hotels and shopping go to Dubai, and this hotel will not disappoint for the money. Lovely views, clean rooms, nice food, nothing to really complain about just did not find the people in Dubai to be friendly, so would not return.

Reviews.Title: “I hated it...”
Reviews.Author: R L
Reviews.Content: In two months, I stayed in this hotel 3 times. The airport pickup didn't arrive, rang the hotel but put on hold for over 10minutes. Doormen and bellboys were too busy chatting amongst themselves or texting on their mobile phones. When you stand outside the resolving door for a taxi, they don't bother to ask if you wish for a taxi as though you were just standing there to enjoy the evening sun. Perhaps the staff felt that they have an expat image and more important then paying customers, hence treating them badly. Most staff don't bother to greet you when they see you. I will never be back to this hotel again. You are better off going to the Radisson Blu across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Service not 5 star :(”
Reviews.Author: Kirsty885
Reviews.Content: People who didnt work behind the desk were much more helpful and friendly. Were told the room would be ready in about an hour, but they never rang to let us know, until we returned hours later :( Room was nice, view over Dubai Creek. Room service was quick and delicious :)

Reviews.Title: “5 star service to go with the 5 star facilities would've been nice”
Reviews.Author: killtacos
Reviews.Content: The luxury of the rooms and décor was counteracted by the general impersonality of staff. The receptionists especially were not forthcoming or friendly and any help or advice had to be dragged out of them, and was often not particularly helpful. The whole place had a very impersonal feel. That said, the facilities are fantastic and the view from our room was beautiful, or as beautiful as a bunch of skyscrapers in a desert can be. The Indian restaurant was the best part of our stay- fantastic service and great food. However, I would probably stay somewhere else if I returned to Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel not upto mark”
Reviews.Author: Rishi19825
Reviews.Content: Well as compared to other five stars hotel this hotel is not at all upto mark. It took us more than 45 minutes to check in the hotel and that too we did not get our preferred rooms . And even in the rooms no view was available. The gym was too small and same as swimming pool. Not upto our expectation.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 5 Star Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SAT33
Reviews.Content: I stayed recently 4 nights at the Sheraton Creek and I have to say the experience was much better than expected. As it is one of first 5 star hotels in Dubai with it's 35 years I was a bit worry about the maintenance and the rooms. But the hotel is looked after very well and the moment you step into the lobby you know you are in a modern 5 star hotel. The service is very friendly, professional and extremely helpful. I stayed in an executive room on the 10th floor and had a fabulous view over the creek. The room itself has everything you need (DVD player, coffee machine) and is spacious enough. There were just 2 things I didn’t like in the room, one was the missing shower cabin (has only a shower over bath tub) and in the afternoon you had to close the curtains as the sunshine was so strong. The airport transfer was included in the rate and was done with a Porsche Cayenne very comfortable! The executive lounge is very nice and the staff very good. You can choose between a breakfast buffet in the Vivaldi restaurant and a small selection in the lounge. The breakfast buffet is not the best but it has enough choices and the quality of food is high. The staff at the breakfast was not that good as elsewhere in the hotel sometimes even rude. But overall I had a very good stay and will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: anwaar_farooqi
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers great value for money. Great location; 5 minutes drive from airport, 2 minutes from Deira city centre and many other attractions including Creek Dhow Cruises. All three main restuartants are the best in their class.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic - felt like royalty”
Reviews.Author: Teac0sy
Reviews.Content: A five star hotel that lives up to that rating - the staff went out of their way to make sure we were made welcome, arrived exhausted at 6am after long flight and we were able to access our room straight away. Facilities were excellent - the room was spacious and elegant, the spa treatment incredibly relaxing and at a reasonable price, meals were great especialy the buffet breakfast. Compllimentary birthday cake delivered to our room to celebrate my husbands birthday was a great touch. We had Dubai as our stopover on trip to Europe and return and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: nazar091
Reviews.Content: This is one of my best recommended Hotel , it is perfect for booth Business and Hollidays, due to its location, facilities, very industry educated staff , helpful , clean, Restaurents and SPA , clean Swimmin Pool , Great fron dest staff and managers ,, etc I stay at this hotel at least 10 times a year for long time ago and I feel it is my secong home

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Celticjo58
Reviews.Content: I found the room disappointing. Furnishings and equipment dated. Bathroom shabby. With all the high quality hotels in Dubai this is a poor option. I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hospitality and would like to re-visit”
Reviews.Author: JoyantaDey
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an amazing hospitality and I cherish to be a guest whenever I am visiting Dubai. The suite was spacious with fantastic bathrobs and comfortable king-size / queen-size beds. Food quality was awesome and was available 24/7.

Reviews.Title: “terrible service/mgmt... and not a great location despite decentish views over creek from some rooms”
Reviews.Author: Kate70
Reviews.Content: My room was not bad at all- lots of light and looking out on to the creek. Even had a view from the bed! (albeit all the workers and builders next door and nearby cld clearly see in as non tinted windows...) But the service in the reception area REALLY lets this hotel down.. overall impression is the management have lost the plot.. far from starwood standards.. and a marked contrast between service in abu dhabi and also le meridien in dubai by the airport... allow lots of time for checking in and out, for qs, for errors - quite a lot of disgruntled people having to wait too long.. and do not expect staff to know anything about dubai or to give directions... the hotel is also quite isolated- nothing to do in the vicinity and not the interesting part of the creek... the pool is not bad and gets some breeze - needed when in the 40's as too hot to stay out long during the day... and poolside service is much better than elsewhere in the hotel. I wld recommend tho looking at the JBR stretch as the nicest bit probably to stay in in dubai with a string of restaurants and also shops plus the beach- sheraton beach etc along there.. of all the hotels i stayed in- the only one where i cld not get the internet to work in the room- and nor cld hotel staff.. albeit a business centre where they charge for access a number of dead restaurants etc - no one in them and lacking character...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay, very relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: pmsonic
Reviews.Content: We had a really enjoyable stay at this hotel. We had a towers room on the 8th floor which was roomy quiet and comfortable with a lovely creek view. As part of the towers room rate we enjoyed all day access to the towers lounge where we could get soft drinks and refreshments, including free alcoholic drinks between 6 and 8.30pm. Snacks were also available late afternoon. With this room you also get breakfast in the Vivaldi restaurant meaning its great value. During our stay we had a fantastic Japanese meal in the Creekside resturant as well as enjoying Ashiana also gave us a tasty Indian meal. The hotel is slightly dated, but you can tell when it was build it was done well meaning there's nice marble touches in the bathroom and a lovely entrance. The pool is a little on the small side, but given this is a business orientated hotel we found plenty of space to swim and sunbathe. One slight negative is the slow reception, staff were helpful but we did find there was a lot of waiting before we were checked in/out. Overall we'd defiantly recommend the Sheraton to friends and would return again. If you do choose to stay here make sure you checkout the Creek area as there's a real 'life' to this part of Dubai and if you want to travel further the Union Metro Station and Water Bus are 5 to 10 mins walk and both very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “They gave me a top-floor room facing the creek and cared for me well.”
Reviews.Author: MountainFriendsPhoto
Reviews.Content: There were no affordable rooms in Dubai, and I was "stuck" needing a room. Sheraton came through and, noticing my camera gear, gave me a creek view room on the top floor. The glass doors opened to a small balcony overlooking the creek and the nghtly fireworks. The bed was great. Everything in Dubai was accessible and the staff was kind. I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base to see Dubai”
Reviews.Author: I_love_holidays015
Reviews.Content: We've just got home from 3 nights staying here and am suitably impressed. The decor etc. is admittedly a little outdated, but if you're looking for a reasonably priced hotel with good facilities and nothing super-fancy then this will do the trick. Regular visitors to Dubai will know that nothing in the city is close to much else, so staying on the creek with it's gorgeous views seemed like the best plan, with the new metro trains and water taxis making everything else easily accessible (and cheap) if you're prepared to walk for 10-15 minutes (although I would probably not recommend walking around the city after about May as it's just too hot!). We were in a towers room, and I'd have to say this was the best decision we made. Non-towers rooms had doors overlooking the lobby which could probably get pretty noisy. The room also included breakfast (very yummy and eaten outside overlooking the creek) and access to the lounge which included a 'happy hour' when wine etc. was free. Internet access was also free with this type of room, along with airport transfers and nice extra touches like fruit in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: AloftWinchester
Reviews.Content: This hotel is reasonably priced compared to the other hotels located nearby the beach. Staff at the front desk were very helpful except they charged extra person fee at check-in since the reservation made over Expedia only stated one person traveling instead of two. Expedia and hotel needs proper communication here. Anyway, room was very spacious and clean. Little outdated decor in the room, but was okay since we were not there to stay inside of hotel all day. Food from room service was good and they had nice pool which we didn't get to enjoy. Concierge was very helpful in helping us with dessert tours and city tours. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for leisure travelers to Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel in great location with just a couple of watchouts”
Reviews.Author: robandsheila
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in a towers creek view room on 7th floor. The view down the creek was fantastic and completely unobstructed. We got a discounted rate on the internet which made this hotel particularly good value for Dubai as towers room rates include airport transfers and free food and drinks (including alcoholic) at happy hours (6pm to 8:30 pm). The hotel is ageing and decor is very traditional and would be familiar to anyone who has stayed in a Sheraton in Europe or USA but very well maintained and the room was spacious with a very comfortable king bed. The full height windows could be opened (unusual in newer hotels in Dubai) which was great for evening photos of the creek. Generally the service was excellent and staff very helpfull. Buffet breakfast in the Vivaldi restaurant (included in our room rate) was very comprehensive catering for all nationalities but now for the first watchout: We would NOT recommend the Vivaldi for dinner as the service was more "Faulty Towers" than Sheraton Towers. We waited 40 minutes for simple 1st course dishes only to receive the wrong order. The head waiter's response was a joke so we cancelled and left without sampling the food which appeared to be somewhat expensive anyway and the tables looked like they were set for breakfast! Not to worry, Dubai has no shortage of restaurants so this is just something to consider when staying at the hotel. The only other problems related to taxis. Once despite being assured that we were given a metered taxi, it proved not to be. This was reported to Guset Services who did seem concerned and said they would look into it. The second taxi problem was with our airport transfer on departure. Despite having the reservaton confirmed the evening before we found our car had taken another guest and was not available at the alloted time. This only caused a 10 minute delay but required some "assertive discussion" with the duty manager who at 1st seemed to think an apology would suffice. These minor glitches aside, the package offered with the towers room proved to be excellent value but make sure you are getting a creek view when booking, the rooms on the front of the hotel overlook a very busy road.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kees55
Reviews.Content: Reading the latest reviews l feel that the hotel deserves some courtesy from our part. It's true that if you are unlucky, the interconnecting hotel doors can turn your stay into a nightmare and it is a rather formal business hotel. But now the positive points: -the (tower)room had sufficient international tv-channels and the bed was of a good quality. -the towerrooms provide at night a wonderful view on the skyline, the creek and its surroundings; (draw the curtains aside when you go to bed and see the boats go by!) -if you are able to walk 700 meters to the convenient metrostation you can easily travel to the airport and other spots without using a taxi (as walking is not a real option). -breakfast is excellent with many fresh fruits and a view on the Creek. -the 'businesscentre option' is really worth it; you can have a little snack, drink, and the internet is good,. -the gym looked okay.as well as the swimming pool. -the (cheap) watertaxi to cross the Creek is closeby. -even the security staff helped us while checking out to prevent a little negligence from our side. -the concierge is willing to make the reservations. -due to our very early departure we received breakfast in our room. In short: a top hotel!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel that can be better if they pay more attention the their staff service qualities”
Reviews.Author: shamlatiff
Reviews.Content: Apparently my first impression of this hotel are the staffs service and attitudes. From the first day I arrive till the last day, I cant seem to get a nice GENUINE smile from any ot the service staffs there. From the front desk to the Business Centre to the restaurant. I dont understand why the management allow these staffs to handle the front end of the hotel if they cant even care to smile.

Reviews.Title: “HOME AWAY FROM HOME”
Reviews.Author: kmaini2000
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this Hotel for the last few times that I am in Dubai. I find this Hotel very comfortable, amazing view of the Creek particularly at night and great service. I find the room sizes much larger than the other hotels which makes it more comfortable and enhances the openess.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointng considering its a Sheraton...”
Reviews.Author: traveler-1234599
Reviews.Content: The hotel locatoin and interior are great. The food (quality and choice) was good as well. However, many rooms have doors facing the lobby so eventhough I was trying to sleep, I could here the lobby noise as if my door was open. Even though a rather small issue, I did not appreciate that at check out they charged one coffee I made in the room as mini bar, even though this coffee bag together with the Nescafe/teas with no sign whatsoever that this was chargeable (more expensive than the coffees in the cafe!). It is a matter of principle that I expect hotels to not hide such costs. When I tried to explain this at check out, the person was very rude and condescending to me. Their Internet charges are very high too. There are so many other great value and quality hotels in this area, so I will definitely never stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor standard for a Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: SolskjaerZA
Reviews.Content: I am a regular traveller to Dubai, and i decided to try out the Sheraton Dubai Creek after reading positive reviews on Tripadvisor. However, it turned out to be one of my worst hotel stays ever. Firstly, when i arrived at the hotel, i was surprised to find out that my room was not ready. Normal check-in time had already passed. I was made to wait for an hour in the hotel lounge after a long flight while my room was cleaned. Eventually i was given a room in the Tower Block. I was very surprised at the standard of the room. I was given a room with an interleading door. Throughout my stay i could hear my neighbour and his guests coming in and out of the room early in the morning. The carpets, linen and curtains were old and worn, furniture was dated, and the bathroom was in a very poor state. The tiles were old and mouldy, the sanitaryware looked ancient and i honestly felt like i was in a 2-star hotel bathroom. The shower in my room also seemed to be erratic; i would be showering with warm water and every few minutes a sudden burst of boiling water would come out (this happened throughout my stay). The housekeeping used to respect my "Do Not Disturb" sign on my door every day, but instead he would be banging his trolley and making a racket outside my door from about 7 a.m. every morning. I had prepaid for my entire stay in advance so there was no way i could move to another hotel without losing money. I stayed at the Hilton Dubai creek previously, which is close to Sheraton, and even thou it is a much smaller hotel, the standard of the rooms in Hilton is much better. Even the Taj Palace hotel, which i have stayed at many times before, is also a way better option than Sheraton. Sheraton Dubai Creek is in urgent need of an upgrade. It is really beginning to show its age and there are many better options in Dubai in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Try the Japanese buffet restaurant, even if you are not staying here.”
Reviews.Author: NewportYfenni
Reviews.Content: We were staying at one of the Dusit Hoteles in Dubai and wanted to try Japanese. At the sheraton the Japanese restaurant, in the corner as you go up the escalator to the mezzanine level, was outstanding and clearly a hit with the Japanese expats who were dining alongside us. The food is buffet style simply laid out and includes sushi, sashimi, korean, tepanyaki chef and stir fried chef cooking anything you desired. The meal was great, service was excellent at 175dhr per person. One to watch the pint of lager was around £8. gb sterling

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Private Taxi Scam”
Reviews.Author: HKFoodie
Reviews.Content: Older hotel but kept up well with above average room size and daily rate of $123 (ex tax) p.n. Friendly and helpful front desk staff tried to accommodate early morning arrival. If you have to go to/from airport during rush hour on work day, this is great location to avoid the traffic jams, otherwise you can find better located hotels in center of town. One major problem was doormen insisted on using "private" unmarked taxis which charge 25% more then regular taxis, even when they use their meter. Even when these private taxis negotiate a fare to the airport (should be around DH 28), they try to rip you off with additional costs. Do yourself a favor and just take a public taxi everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: GIPARioDeJaneiro
Reviews.Content: Sheraton creek is definitively a good option in Dubai , although not so central , along the creek. Very friendly staff , that solved all the questions I had , at a smiling way. Good rooms , excellent breakfast but a little bit confused , becuae of the mix of different types of food. The only thing I disliked was the temperature at the swimming pool: it is an opened swimming pool but with ...hot water! Why warming water , at a desert , where you are looking for refreshment?

Reviews.Title: “My Choice out of Starwood Hotels in Deira”
Reviews.Author: Sina149
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Dubai Creek was the 2nd hotel ever in Dubai!!! It's placed opposite famous Dubai Creek in Deira Area. The hotel is old but after renovations, sounds to be Ok. The front desk staff were polite and professional and having very good SPG Platinum recognition. I've received an upgrade to Executive Suite with City View. Thanks to the Duty Manager -Mr. Christian- I've changed the room to the same but with amazing Creek View! I just like the Creek View too much to chose any other hotel! Overall an OK 5-Star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A real Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: bibiblock
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Sheraton and didn't spend a lot of time in the Hotel. The location is good if you want to visit the old town but far from the new part and the big shopping malls. The Hotel is quiet old and the room design reflects not the newest style. In generally it is very clean and truly 5 Star. Service excellent and Sheraton like. The Restaurants are not the best in town but a good option if you want to stay in house. Room service worked well! Staff is good trained and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Steer clear, there are better options in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: DrSnafu
Reviews.Content: The Dubai Creek Sheraton is one of the oldest hotels in Dubai and it shows. Compared to other hotels, the rooms are old and stuffy. Pros: - Pretty much every room has a view of the river/creek and big opening windows which is kind of rare. - The Indian and Japanese restaurants are pretty good - You can do a nice walk past the Deira wharves to the gold/spice souqs Cons: - This is an old school hotel in more ways than one. They try to scam money out of you at every opportunity. Every tiny detail is charged extra and the prices are ridiculous, especially the internet, and there is no free wifi in the lobby. This is reason alone not to stay here imho. - When we checked out we were shocked to find many mysterious items from other guests added to our bill! - Rooms are tired. Mine had a cigar burn on the floor and I was given a stinky smoking room - The reception is a joke, it's always busy. You feel like you have to book a meeting to talk to people there [they have sit down desks instead of a counter]. - The pool looks great on the website but it's pretty unglamorous in real life, on the ground floor surrounded by walls.

Reviews.Title: “I just don't get all the negative reviews on here!”
Reviews.Author: JGX
Reviews.Content: I am typing this in the Hotel Lounge having been here for 3 nights so far. Having read all of the dreadful reviews on here, I rang the hotel to express me concerns last week - naturally, they assured me that this was indeed a 5 star hotel but I was unconvinced. Nonetheless, the reservation had been made through Expedia and was non-refundable so we prepared ourselves for the worst. We are staying in a 'Towers Room' which included access to the Towers Lounge (free breakfast, internet access, soft drinks all day and alcoholic drinks & snacks between 5pm and 8pm) and airport transfers. The hotel itself is one of the oldest in Dubai and is not uber-trendy but it is well presented, clean and tidy and the rooms whilst not the most modern are comfortable and well maintained. The pool and gym/spa are excellent and the restaurants (we have only eaten breakfast at the hotel so far) seem good. The greatest asset are, without question, the staff, who are, each and every one of them SUPERB! Nothing is too much trouble and everything is done with extreme politeness and a smile. The hotel is about a 10 - 15 minute walk from Union metro station and that (to be honest) is the easiest way to get about. It's about a 20 minute walk from the Gold Souq and a 20 minute metro ride from the Dubai Mall/Mall of the Emirates. One tip - try the Samad Iraqi Restaurant, Al Muraqqabat Road (18th Road) - which is about a 15 minute walk or 5 minute cab ride from the hotel - amazing food at really really reasonable prices (150ish AED for dinner for two!!!). My advice, ignore the moaning-Minnie reviews on here and give this hotel a try.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations Hardly Met”
Reviews.Author: miaminumberone
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Dubai with some colleagues of mine. As part of our trip we decided to visit some hotels. Our favorite hotel all around was the Atlantis on Palm Island. What a spectacular experience. The Sheraton Dubai Creek was the most disappointing of all. Some members of the staff just seemed to be unfriendly. The abundance of eastern european prostitutes in the immediate area was a bit off-putting, portraying seedy air in the lobby. I was more impressed with some of the middle-eastern employees as opposed to the Europeans. Some of the european workers just seemed to be stuck-up and cheeky. I got this impression both from some of the management that I encountered and some of the employees. Based on this attitude alone, i would not recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AKabani
Reviews.Content: We had this hotel booked for us by a travel agent and when we checked in, we were not given the rooms we had booked. I was told to email our reservation to the manager, and I did, but I never received a reply. We had booked tower rooms, but were initially given classic rooms. We were told that we would be moved the next day. The next day, Chrisitian, the Duty manager was very kind and allowed us to move to the tower rooms. However, there was work being done on the 9th floor (and we were on the 10th floor), so there was a lot of noise banging and clanking starting at 10am. The salon was great. They were reasonably priced and the hairdresser was from Syria. The executive lounge, located in the lobby, was very nice and pleasant. Overall, this is a fine hotel, but I expected better from them. They appeared confused alot and had trouble accommodating its high occupancy.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in budget.”
Reviews.Author: Ankit B
