Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days. Nice location for stay in dubai. It is in midst of everything. Not too close to anything nor far from anywhere. Just look out for traffic timings to avoid JAM. SPA in hotel was good but not upto International standards.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel, Great Staff, much too short of a stay!!”
Reviews.Author: scterminator
Reviews.Content: Fifth stay at the Sheraton Dubai Creek; I would stay there every day if I could. The staff is the friendliest in the entire region and arguably one of kindest staffs around the globe. Great food at Vivaldi's, club lounge superb, easy access to taxi, laundry service first-rate, and room cleanliness fantastic. What tops it off is being welcomed by the staff; they are exemplary! Can't wait to stay again soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with Terrible Servicehe”
Reviews.Author: TravelLeisure_10
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to the region and I must say that this was a terrible hotel. The room was old and smelled like mold. I called the front desk but they did not do anything about it. The attendant at the lounge was always on the phone. We felt like we were disturbing here every time we went in there. On top of the service, my colleague and I became sick from the Indian restaurant in the hotel. I contacted the hotel and the manager Heinz Grub they did not have the decency to respond to me. I wanted to inform them about the restaurant and at least get an apology. We were sick for a week from the food poisoning. As a SPG Platinum member, I expected a little more from the management. I will not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The Creek”
Reviews.Author: Marcus_Drexler
Reviews.Content: Like : Marhaba Service at the airport.. On time car pick-up! took us only aroung 15 minutes to reach the hotel. receptionist are so friendly we have a perfect view of the creek (room) i love the japanese restaurant! Dislike: very slow food delivery at the room service a/c not that good wifi not free but overall we enjoyed our stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Just Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: Honiawy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed 14 days/13 nights in Sheraton Creek Dubai for my business trip, as I was enrolled in PetroSkills course (which was given at Dibba Hall in the business center in the hotel). Very clean & neat hotel, very friendly & professional staff, amazing restaurants - I loved breakfast at the Vivaldi (though lunch wasn't that good) whereas Ashyana & CreekSide had great lunch meals. the rooms were awesome, large beds (yet the pillows weren't my favourite - but I can live with that) & classy furniture, bathrooms were very nice. I went to the gym several times, very cool with sauna & steam rooms. The swimming pool is relatively a small one, I haven't tried the massage but it looked nice. I loved the Chelsea arms pub, very very relaxing atmosphere. Even sitting in the lobby reading newspapers put on the table is fun!!. The only drawback from my point of view is the internet connection!! -- It was very expensive that I had to go to an internet cafe few streets away (Internet at the hotel costs 104.5 AED/day or 15 AED for 15 min. in the business center). I strongly recommend this hotel for business trips in Dubai - You will simply love it!! Special greetings for the staff who I loved very much - receptionists Mohamed, Tanja ( I simply loved her!) & Mrs. Guzman ( A very very nice lady!) & Ivette in the Chelsea arms pub (very funny girl!). I'd really really love to come back to you guys at Sheraton Creek Dubai, You will always be my first choice in Dubai. Regards, Hany

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but tired business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anionfan
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a week liong stay at the SBC. This was my second visit, so I knew what to expect in terms of location and amenities. This time we decided to book a Towers room though, treat ourselves to the extras. Although I know it's really a business hotel, I didn't want to go to a resort and deal with screaming kids peeing in the pool and Russian lesbians hogging the sunbeds. Location is great, only 15 mins from the airport, 10 minutes from the Gold Souk and 20-30 minutes from the malls - depending on traffic. Getting taxis is easy, though it would be nice if the drop off area out the front of the hotel weren't parked up with cars, so you could take your time over getting in/out and paying. It's nice to be able to walk along the creek in the evening, and check out all the boats. We contacted them 2 weeks in advance to get an early check in, which they said wasn't a problem. Airport transfer was fine, got the Cayenne, figured we were onto a winner. So was more than a bit peeved to be told that as the hotel had been full the previous night, and our room wasn't ready. They asked for a couple of hours, so we went and had breakfast, then had a snooze by the pool. 2 hours later we returned, and given that we'd booked a Towers room, I was a bit miffed to be given a Classic Room, even it had been upgraded to a Creek view. Bear in mind we'd had an overnight flight, and I hadn't had any sleep, all I wanted was to get into my room, get into my swimsuit and crash by the pool. And by the time we'd unpacked, I couldn't face repacking and fighting with reception to get another room. So no idea what the Towers room looked like. Our Classic room was fine, plenty of wardrobe space, king size bed, sofa, desk etc. Bathroom was standard Sheraton brown marble, planty of mirrors and big towels, however the grouting between the tiles really needs replacing. The poor design of the shower means that water cascades over the side of the bath and floods the floor by the toilet - so that area is all black with mildew. I had to downgrade my sleep quality, owing to the Aircon which seemed to be a bit random, kept resetting in the night. And as our room was right by the loft lobby, we had to listen to everyone either waiting, or getting out. Housekeeping was good, bathroom bits replaced everyday, only problem we had was with getting clean glasses. They left us a plate of fruit each day, can I suggest they add a knife? There's wifi in the lobby, and I think maybe the Lounge; the room had a wired connection which didn't seem to be free, given the argument we overheard with a guy as he was checking his bill befiore checking out. Or maybe thyat was another Towers option we missed out on. The pool isn't huge, and for me was too warm - which could just be due to the fact that the sun warms it up, being so small. There were plenty of sunbeds, given that there can't have been more than 10 of us there at any time. If you ask me, they should get rid of the tennis court and make the pool bigger. Didn't use the Spa or Health Club, so no comment. All massages though, no beauty treatments All 3 of the restaurants are fabulous where the food is concerned, although service is slow even though there are loads of staff and I found the live music in the Indian to be too loud for us to have a conversation above it. Coming from the UK, it was particularly nasty to find that the Chelsea Arms still allows smoking - even most places in Europe don't allow this now. The air conditioning seems to keep the place cool, but doesn't remove the fug. Good choice of beers, nice and cold. Someone tell me why the Towers lounge is on the lobby floor, with no windows? I had expected it to be at least on the 8th floor, with a decent view - I bet more people would use it if it was. As it happened, it was usually deserted apart from the folks using the free internet to access their facebook accounts. The hot canapes served in the early evening didn't seem to be kept hot enough, and there was nothing to keep the flies off the cold food. Don't get me wrong, I had a lovely week; I didn't have to fight for a sunbed, the food was good, the G&Ts strong - I just can't help feel I was short changed by my Classic room.

Reviews.Title: “Very underwhelmed by service provided when we needed it most”
Reviews.Author: foxystoat1
Reviews.Content: Was supposed to be staying at the Sheraton Dubai Creek for 6 nights as part of a honeymoon in the United Arab Emirates. Arrived late evening only to be told that our booking had been cancelled as the agents we had booked the reservation with had filed for bankruptcy protection in the USA 5 days before our wedding and the actual reservation was cancelled by the third party (who had not been paid by the agents) on the day of our wedding, two days before arrival. Were provided an alternative room within the hotel but not at the rate I had previously booked the room for. Room was standard business traveller fayre (3rd foor), albeit a little oversized, bathroom was good, plenty of lotions available. Good views over the creek. However, the arrival in the room was tarnished by an over zealous porter who, having been tipped what I felt was an appropriate amount, felt it necessary to ask me "Are you aware of the value of currency in this country?"This left a sour taste with us, especially having travelled most of the day only to find out about the reservation had been cancelled. Spent most of the night trying to sort out the cancelled reservation issue with the reception staff and Duty Manager, who were distant when i was explaining the situation, and did not leave me feeling that I was in need of assistance, desk staff more interested with checking their computers than providing eye to eye contact.The Duty Manager did allow me use of the internet facilities to sort out arrangements. Having tried (unsuccessfully) to resolve the issue with Starwood (Sheraton parent company) via the LiveChat facility on their website, I found another hotel nearby (The SAS Radisson) and made a booking for the rest of the week at their hotel. Early next morning, I checked out the Sheraton in more detail. Although initially impressed with the grandeur of the lobby area (the interior reminded me of the Luxor in Las Vegas, a tall, triangular structure, the pool area was on the small side, and there seemed a lac of things for the holidaymaker to do within the hotel (there was an English bar, an Indian Restaurant and another dining area where the internet facilities were, other than that, there didn't seem too much to do . There are three desks at reception, it took about 20 minutes to eventually get seen to not because there were lots of customers, it seemed that each customer was with each receptionist for a long long time, when eventually got to the check-out, it took a long time to manage this process, with the credit card authorisation and the passing over of the invoice from a receptionist who again, seemed distant and not providing me with her fullest attention. In hindsight, it turned out that our booking being cancelled turned out for the best as we had an absolutely amazing experience at the nearby SAS Radisson, 400 yards along the road (I will be reviewing the Radisson in the next day or two...). I dare say the Sheraton is a good hotel for the business traveller and casual visitor, but we were left very disappointed with our experience on what should have been one of the most happiest times of our lives. Although most of the staff were friendly enough on face value (porter excepted), they did not show complete interest or attention to us, which, in a country which prides itself on customer focus, came as a bitter disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Stay”
Reviews.Author: haroonb
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here begining of June..Booked 2 tower rooms with lounge acess , one for me and the wife and one for the kids. Ive been to Dubai over 8 times and this was the best. What a start.. free aiport pickup in a Porche Cayenne. We arrived at 7am and my 2 rooms were ready for cheack in (Also had a choice of rooms) Wonderfull view of the creek from a 7th floor room. Room was oversize and spacious,well furnished and all what ull expect in a 5 star hotel. Breakfast was excellent witnh lovely views of creek while eating. Lounge was basic but available 24 hrs a day. We requested a late checkout as we had a flight at 2am and this request was duly accepted with a chekout at 8pm at no extra cost. We felt like royalty here and all staff were really friendly and helpfull!! Al Ghuarair Shopping Centre(spelling may be wrong), Naif road,monorail station all within walking distance and taxis were also freely available from hotel.Luggage storage was added service to us as i went to USA for another 6 weeks and left a bag in storage here which i picked up on my way from. All in all a wonderfull stay and for the amount we paid,worth every cent!!!Will definitely recommend this one anytime!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: Pippi2
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of attending a course and staying at this hotel for 6 nights in beginning of June. As a part of the package paid by my company I got picked up by a driver at the airport. If the pick-up service deal is not a part of your package, there is no need to think you need to book this service. It is much cheaper to take a normal taxi from the airport to the hotel. In fact I would advise you to avoid the hotel’s own car service during your stay if you want to save money. The hotel cars do not have a taxi sign, but they have meters that are running at a higher rate than normal taxis. Just ask the porter for a normal taxi when you need transport. Normal taxis in Dubai are clean and safe. Check-in process was a bit slow, but the receptionists are polite and friendly. My room was on the second floor with twin beds and it was rather spacious with comfortable beds. There is wired internet in the room that you can use for a fee. The bathroom was very clean and had a nice selection of bathroom supplies. The buffet breakfast in the Vivaldi restaurant had a great selection of food. It was still possible to sit outside on the restaurant’s balcony to enjoy the breakfast and the view of the creek during my stay. The lunch was served in the Creekside restaurant. This food was OK. However, at night this is a Japanese restaurant and the food is fantastic. We had dinner here one night when it was Asian buffet and I still dream of the fabulous sushi, teppanyaki and the dessert. Another highlight in the hotel is the Indian restaurant, Ashiana, rated as one of the best Indian restaurant in Dubai. Several nights were spent in the pub, which was also OK. In the pub there is normally a mix of guests and some locals. A few nights two girls would show up that would offer male guests their services, but this did not bother me as I’m female in my mid 30’s and the girls were not offensive towards any of us. The pool area is decent, but if I was in Dubai for a relaxing holiday I would pick another hotel. For business this hotel is very convenient due to the location and the selection of restaurants in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mm7061
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights during a trip around the Middle East. Nice hotel, friendly receptionists upon arrival and a nice room with a view over the Creek.... Not wonderfully located if you want to go to the new side of Dubai, but the staff were pleasant and the Italian restaurant in particular was very good!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with a fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: fivestarholidays
Reviews.Content: was on a holiday with my sister and her 2 children. The rooms are spacious and well maintained and the view from our room was simply awesome. The staff is very efficient and helpful. The lebanese sweets they serve round the clock in their lounge was the best I have eaten and they v kindly gave us the address from where these could be bought. Breakfast spread is large and great quality. Redressal to a complaint is prompt.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: NSS27
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Dubai Creek Hotel and Towers Date: 15 May 2010 I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights with my parents. We took a triple sharing room. Most of the properties you stay at cannot comfortably accommodate 3 adults in one room. But the rooms at The Sheraton are very spacious. We stayed on the Club Floor facing the Deira Creek. Beautiful view of the creek by day & night. Service was impeccable. Delicious food and very friendly service at all times. Decently located. Walking distance from the train station and just a few minutes from Deira City Centre Mall.

Reviews.Title: “wish i was there again-excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: alexia_k
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel with my partner for 12 days.the room was excellent and the creek view sight from our room was breathtaking..!!!As I am a receptionist in a 5* hotel here in Greece,I couldn't resist comparing your services with many other 5*hotels I have worked or visited as a customer.The room was thoroughly cleaned daily,we never had any problem in the restaurant ,never had any problem with taxis(could always choose limo or normal taxi-it was up to us)and the staff in general was very polite and helpful....apart from the reception staff! I was really disappointed for a 5* hotel!We arrived around 22.30 and were told that all the restaurants were closed.,so our only option was the room service which was quite expesive.We found out the next day from the hotel directory that was in our room that one of the restaurants didn't close till 23 or 23.30(can't remember exactly).Isn't it common sense that the reception staff should know at least the basics,such as what time the hotel restaurants close!!??During our stay our guide had left us 3 times messages concerning our excursions and finally our departure time ,which we never got.Also the day before our departure we wanted to sort out our bill-IT WAS A NIGHTMARE!!!!The night we arrived had a room with view to the road and asked to change the following day to a creek view room with extra charge,which is common sense.But on our bill it was charged also the day of our arrival.If i hadn't noticed that i would have paid it.Also without asking us they had charged another 100AED for a fund support .If they had asked if we wanted to pay that i wouldn't mind,but i got annoyed they didn't ask.When i refused to pay that charge the receptionist wasn't quite happy with that and didn't like that i complained.So,apart the reception staff,everything was excellent and all the standards of a 5* hotel apply to Sheraton Creek.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gevara
Reviews.Content: Pros: Checkin and Check out was smooth. The hotel lobby is nice and huge with a lot of nice cafes. The room was big, clean and very comfortable. Truely 5 Stars. Hotel Staff except for the restaurants are very helpful Cons: Restaurants were not so good and they have a huge problem with the service in all of the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinkchouchong
Reviews.Content: Went to Dubai for the May Day holiday and stayed at Sheraton Creek for two nights. Would not rate it a five star hotel, more of a 4 star. Good lobby but since we were not given a room in the tower or with a creek view, the room in the back is rather dark and old. We had a toddler with us, but didn't feel the floor was clean enough for babies to crawl around the room, as they tend to do. Good hotel for business people, but not for tourists since even the closet attraction, i.e. gold souk and spice souk are some ten-fifteen minutes by taxi. And the two markes were not all that spectacular unless one is serious gold or spice buyers. All the other major attraction are way across the town on the other side of the creek. Nice staff and excellent breakfast and room service. The walk along the creek in the evening was very pleasant. Would not recommand this hotel to tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Slowly declining, with occasional spells of hope”
Reviews.Author: HighExpectationsGuy
Reviews.Content: OK the location is nichy, and it is getting tired, but it still has it's charms. Breakfast on the Creek watching the abras and yachts stream by, a newish executive lounge. It is not ideal for the airport, because of the very heavy traffic at the approach, but if you want to be in the area, why not try it!

Reviews.Title: “Far away from 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: roomrunner
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very old special bath room. Room cleaning not up to the standard, hair in the bath tube when we checked in. This hotel still has shower in Bath ,Bath curtain very smelly We have ask for bath rope, they told us we only give bath rope on request. Breakfast staff not up to the standard and not proper trained. They serve instant decaffeinate coffee at the breakfast. the same as in the room. this they call 5 star standard, every morning we have to ask for fresh coffee, also this was prepared in advance and tasteless. There was one lady staff ( Not mistaken from Bulgaria ) she was good, after a couple of days complaining she was the one who prepared us fresh coffee. Breakfast announced till 11.00Hr, at 10.20hr start to clear already ( Friday morning ) for local is like Sunday The hotel is quite far away from everything except airport, we need all the time taxi.When ask doorman for taxi, they call their hotel taxi/Limo without asking,this taxi is more than double the price. When you ask for normal taxi, they tell you no taxi , you wait !!!. and they let you wait .... Knowing there are many taxi's. ( We experience twice the taxi driver dropped a client by the hotel and immediately he was ask to leave quickly, I notice this and quickly we jump in to this taxi than the taxi driver told us that they where chased away because the doorman want to push the hotel taxi's.The best is, we walked to the road and catch a taxi from there,within minutes. Internet in the room very expensive Dh50.per hour. When you ask hotel staff for information nobody knows anything. I ask information for shopping mails, I have spoken to 5 staff and still they give me the wrong information. In general the hotel is sure not a 5 star, and not ready to serve there clients. When we checked out, and they ask how was our stay , and we mention our experiences, they looked at us like what to do. like its normal. No reaction given. or apology. The only thing they say " Hope to seen you again " we told them " Don't count on it "...... I will sure advise others not to stay there when they look for 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for business or overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: SoCal_bound
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Dubai Creek for one night, while passing through Dubai. Although the lobby is quite impressive, the room itself is just a standard Sheraton room. We booked a city view room but were upgraded to a creek view room. Although it was a nice view I probably wouldn’t have paid the extra just for the one night. The hotel is only about 10 mins from the airport by taxi, and is also next to the water taxi stop that takes you across to Burj Juman. The service we received from the reception desk was efficient and friendly. We ate out that night so I can’t comment on the restaurants or any of the hotel facilities, but for a business stay or overnight trip it would be fine. We got a good price on Expedia, which for a hotel like the Sheraton was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Could not do enough to help, fantastic”
Reviews.Author: melprater
Reviews.Content: We were stuck in Dubai due to the Volcano and needed accomodation, From the moment I phoned the reservations team at Dubai Sheraton they could not do enough to help us. They gave us a very good rate. The Staff were all so helpful and charming. The restaurants were superb. Thank you for helping at a very stressful time.

Reviews.Title: “Miss it Loads”
Reviews.Author: tony_kitchen
Reviews.Content: We Have stayed at The Sheraton Dubai Creek And Towers 6 Times for Ten days at a time. Not once have we had a bad stay. All the Staff from the Doorman to Room Butlers have been the best who have looked after us. We tried a different holiday last year and in March this year and no where near this hotel. WE WILL BE BACK The restarants are all very very good Briliant Indian Food and Service, Japanees food and service and the Italian is Briliant and the Manager and Staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraWigan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights on our way to Sri Lanka and loved Dubai and this hotel. Our original hotel the Rydges Plaza did not have a room booking but they were kind enough to taxi us across to the towers and thanks to the very helpful man on reception (sorry can't remember his name) we had a wonderful stay. We travelled with Mercury Direct who I would NOT recommend as we arrived in Dubai to find no transfer and when one did turn up the original hotel room had been cancelled. It was due to the wonderful stay at the Towers that this did not turn into a disaster. The view over the creek is amazing and we had fireworks on the last night which felt like they were right outside the window. The English bar is very traditional but a little pricey £40 for 2 drinks and 2 soups, but there is a shopping centre (Twin towers) just across the road where you can get very cheap meals. The hotel is just up the road from the tourist bus stop which takes you round all the sites and the dhow trip which takes you 'up the creek', you don't need a paddle just sit back and relax. It's very interesting watching all the old dhows being packed with white goods and computers for transport. If you walk 10 mins outside the hotel to the left you will find the local shops which sell 'everything'. It's very manic but worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Old wine in old bottle”
Reviews.Author: munna50099
Reviews.Content: The point in choosing a centrally located hotel in a metropolis with a good brand name is sometimes lost in the overall experience. I shall come to the point immediately : PROS: 1. Centrally located, Five star property with all amenities, good brand image, comfortable, convenient, clean rooms, great view of the dubai creek, ok food, courteous staff but just two points for true value. CONS: 1. Service is not impeccable. 2. The comfort does not give you a feeling of wholesome satisfaction. 3. Although all amenities are available, they are more for namesake than for real pleasure, like the small swimming pool and the old lobby. 4. The service of Sheraton is there, but not upto the mark, like at the restaurant in the morning, you keep asking for a cup of coffee, but there is nobody to attend to you, they are under-staffed. 5. The hotel is pricey. 6. The ambience could be better. The hotel definitely needs renovation at both lobby level and the rooms too. Even while we stayed at the executive suite, i wanted to shout "ive seen better ". They could do with speedier check-inns/ check outs. 7. A hotel which has even just four guests at a suite, who all are pure vegans, and they dont get one single vegan dish at the breakfast buffet deserves a thumbs down? VERDICT: No dont bother with Sheraton Dubai Creek Hotel, at the same price you can get a better hotel, even the same starwood or sheraton brand. Dont be fooled by the central location, in Dubai, with good roads and efficient transportation, Jumeriah Beach is a better location where you can find better hotels at lesser price and you can be in the city centre in 10-15 minutes. The city is full of other 5 star properties, and you can get a better bargain than this. This looked like an old business hotel to me where only business bargain hunters should stay who like their old wine in old bottles

Reviews.Title: “could not fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: DAVETLuton
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for four nights as a surprise for my sons 16th birthday. We stayed on the 11th floor the views of the creek were amazing we had access to the lounge for drinks at anytime of the day and alcoholic drinks from 1800 to 2030 ,free internet in the lounge also included and transfers to and from airport . Breakfast had a great selection and we always had it on the terrace overlooking the creek . All of the staff were excellent from house keeping to management nothing was too much trouble,they all made it a birthday surprise my son will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel to stay during business trips”
Reviews.Author: WimAA
Reviews.Content: I know there are million of other hotels in Dubai, but this one with the view over the creek and shopping malls around gives a special flavour to the business trips. Every time again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Dubai Centre”
Reviews.Author: AMRFIKRY
Reviews.Content: Spacious Rooms. Best Views of Dubai Creek; day & night. Friendly Staff. Attentive Management that will always go an extra mile to make stay a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to stay in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: ROCKrON
Reviews.Content: Came to Dubai to catch Nickelback concert and the Dubai shopping festival. We decided to book a tower room on this hotel thru their website. Its a great deal with breakfast, butler service and free transfer from/to the airport. The car used for our transfer was a porsche cayenne that make us feel VIP's. We really like this hotel not only for its great location but the service and friendliness of there staff. We been to all major shopping malls without hassle via the dubai metro which has a station nearby the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: ladygeorge85
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights, with my other half and another couple. We stayed in the towers room which is definitely worth the extra ££s. I booked a couple of months in advance on their website and got a fantastic rate. It was at least half the price of the usual rates. The rooms where spacious. One room had king sized bed, and the other was twin beds (each bed could sleep two though). The views were creek side and amazing. We were on the 11th floor which is said to be the best. We were collected from the airport in a Porsche Cayenne, AHEM!! The buffet breakfast was delicious and the towers lounge (for towers rooms guests only) served complimentary drinks and snacks. Could not fault this hotel, if Dubai is your bag baby I would definitely recommend this :o)

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fabulous would highly recommend it to everyone”
Reviews.Author: yuvilover
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a three night stay in Dubai. I went with my husbnad, my father, and my three children aged 9, 6 and 2. We stayed in the towers room which is definitely worth the extra ££s. I booked three months in advance on their website and got a fantastic rate. It was at least 50% cheaper than the usual rates. The rooms where spacious. One room had king sized bed, and the other was twin beds (each bed could sleep two though). The views were creek side and amazing. We were on the 11th floor which is said to be the best. From the moment we were picked up at the airport (complimentary service and in a Porsche Cayenne no less) to the moment we were left we could not fault the hotel. The buffet breakfast was delicious nd the towers lounge (restricted to towers rooms guests only) served complimentary drinks and snacks. I would love to go back to Dubai in the next year or two and would definitel stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sherman.Yu
Reviews.Content: The hotel look is quiet good when arrival. Lobby is good classic hotel decoration, although this is not modern and grand,but i feeling that so comfortable and silent. I'm reserved the creek view room, the room decoration is old classic but clean. I'm enjoy the coffee, complimentary fruits and the creek view on my sofa, that feeling "relax" !! Some mistake in room is the window is quiet dusty although we can open window. it maybe need to remind hotel's house keeping!! I'm also swim in the pool, it is not big but good enough cuz not many ppls!! In conclusion, this hotel is near Union metro station, by walk just only under 10mins, we also can get the taxi easily outside the hotel main entrance. Go to some major travellers point by taxi or metro is not very expensive. Some opinions to hotel or travellers is try to don't arrival dubai before 1200pm, because we're arrived at 0600am and really tired of our 9hrs flight, but they don't have rooms told by receptionist, let say you will paid more 25% daily room rate for early check-in, you're also need to wait until 0900am and no any suggestion to you, just only wait or leave your luggage and go outside!! The security staff always smiles and politely, but the receptionist is look smart and professional but not many smiles. Although i think this is business hotel, but always keep the smiles to every guest is important let's on 0600am, if they can always doing by heart and not only is job. I think this is a very good and really need to stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Blah”
Reviews.Author: notthemaniusedtobe
Reviews.Content: Of all the hotels I've ever stayed in, this was most definitely one of them. That's all I can say. Nicely furnished and comfortable, but largely without personality. Check-in and out process was miserably slow. NO FREE INTERNET! They tried hard to up-sell for free drinks and free internet, but it was prohibitively expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Experience”
Reviews.Author: travel0927
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel, for 3 nights in July 09. We arrived off an early flight, before 7am, and were given our room straight away, also invited to upgrade at a very small cost,which we did. A lovely view of the Creek, from a very spacious room, more like an apartment, with everything one could need. Smiling,very pleasant staff in every part of the Hotel. Food was excellent,seated with best views. Pool was very nice, staff there great as well, we needed to swim in 40+ o.! In spite of this, Dubai was an interesting and very different culture to experience,easy to get around and so much to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent; would stay here again and recommend highly.”
Reviews.Author: fly44us
Reviews.Content: This hotel is superb, including the personnel, service, food, room accommodations, Towers Lounge, fitness center. The location is excellent, right ON the creek, which is bustling with business all day. Yes, it is worth every penny or point to get a Towers Creek view room. We received complimentary early check-in and late check-out. I emailed beforehand with Antony Wade, Deputy General Manager, who was most helpful answering all my questions about rooms and reservations. Mr. Andreas Duerkoop, Director of Guest Services, went above and beyond with emails to me handling several reservations for golf, tours, and dining reservations. As a result, everything was done beforehand, so we could enjoy a beautiful, hassle-free stay. I just can't say enough good things about this property and the staff. We would definitely stay here again. The decision is between "downtown" vs. the beach area; for us, this was not a beach vacation, so we enjoyed being in the heart of the business district, close to the dhow wharf and gold souk, and cruise terminal and airport. My thanks again to Mr. Wade and Mr. Duerkoop, and all their staff, for making this trip one of our best anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good 5 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnnaScorpio
Reviews.Content: I stayd on SPG floor (5th for Starwood prefered guests). Was surprised that my colleague's room on the Classic floor (1st floor) was better than mine! Classic room on the 1st floor had brand new furniture, very nice decorated, but city view, not Creek view. I reccomend this option ;) Air conditioner works noisy, bathroom is so and so ... Rooms have no balconies, but windows can be opened. Breakfast was fantastic, with lot's of choises, fresh juices, proper coffee mashine where u can make espresso or capuccino, several hot dishes, like grilled tomatoes, different kinds of fried eggs. Didn't try the pool and other leisure facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Old Establishement but Great Location and Restaurants”
Reviews.Author: RWC74
Reviews.Content: I travel to Dubai frequently, have stayed in several hotels in Dubai, Sheraton Dubai Creek, is one of my favorite hotel to stay. Great location, close to business district and shopping malls, there are 3 good restaurants, the Indian restaurant is one of the best in town, great view, friendly and helpful staff. In overall, this is one of the best choice to stay in Dubai if you are on business trip. The only drawback is it's an old hotel, but it worth staying...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: LakshmiCa
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, friendly staff, central location. The room was spotless and the staff honored our wedding anniversary by sending to the room the most delicious cake & upgraded us to a beautiful room. Creek view is a must. Nice pool. Quiet and a great place to relax and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at nice establishment.”
Reviews.Author: peeweekathi
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here, for a couple of days shopping on a Dubai stop over. Lovely Hotel in a good central location. Nothing was too far away from here! The Hotel itself, is lovely and big. The room we stayed in, on the 6th floor, with a Creek view, was spacious and comfortable. We expected two single beds, but had two queen beds in the room. Nice large bathroom, toiletries supplied, hair dryer and ironing facilities in room. Good aircon. Great price found on internet, with buy two nights, get one free night, free room upgrade to Creek view and breakfast included, for $200 AU per night! Worked out well for us, because our late arrival in Dubai, meant we had to stay three nights. Staff very friendly, polite and helpful. Desert safari trip organised through reception, which all went smoothly. Smoking no longer permitted inside hotel, except for bar, which is open till late and balcony off breakfast area. Smoking also permitted out front of hotel and ashtrays are supplied!! Drinks in bar are pricey, but you don't have to buy a drink to smoke in there and the staff soon get used to you popping in, if you are a smoker:) Breakfast was fantastic and plenty to be had! What didn't they have there?! Chef makes eggs as you like them, so no rubbery eggs here. Wait staff very attentive. Didn't have dinner in Hotel, but Vivaldi restaurant looked good. Small gift shop off lobby, with reasonably priced, but limited souveniers. Lovely swimming pool and sun lounges. Taxis to most major shopping malls and souks, should cost around 15-30 dirhams. Taxi to airport, approx. 30 dirhams.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible rooms and poor service”
Reviews.Author: dubai09
Reviews.Content: This has to be the worst hotel in Dubai, the staff are surly and unhelpful we didn't even get help with our bags at the door, the receptionist continously scowled at us while arranging our keys. The rooms are dark and outdated, the bathrooms falling apart, the balcony was filthy and the 'view' was of the hotel roof. We called reception and asked if there was something else available, we were ignored twice and had to walk back to reception to speak to someone. We were offered another room again filthy balcony, outdated room, no view. We asked to cancel the booking and had to speak to the manager to arrange this. She promised that we would not be charged and apologised profusely. On returning home we have found that we have been charged and are waiting for the hotel to call back and resolve this.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place”
Reviews.Author: Padi_9
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located-close to main city and shopping center, and also easy access to main link road to industrial city of Dubai ( Jebel ali ). The hotel staff behavior is extremely curtious and the food on their main floor restaurants is extremely delicious ! from the back side windows one gets a romantic view of creek and can oversee Bur Dubai on the other side. I have been to this hotel more than 10 times and would love to visit them again !!

Reviews.Title: “Way short of 5 star”
Reviews.Author: dcp_7
Reviews.Content: We were picked up at the airport by the hotel and the driver was both pleasant and punctual. Once in the hotel the lobby is impressive but we had to wait for over quarter of an hour to be served at the reception with less than courteous staff. Despite it being 4.30 in the afternoon no room was available and we had to wait for one to become free. We had booked a towers room, the premium level of this hotel, so had expected better service and certainly not to have to wait till early evening to get a room. Eventually we were shown to the room which wasnt 5 star. It was dowdy, worn and felt very dated. The bathroom was small, dark and like something out of the 90's, the shower wasn't even separate from the bath so we had an awful shower curtain. The saving grace was the view over the creek, but the double doors to the step out balcony were locked and there was no key. I will say the room was clean but of 4 star standard at best. What a standard room looked like I dread to think. No turn down service was given, and the towers lounge stuck off the lobby had no windows and the food offerings were paltry. Be warned the coffee machine in your room, takes the special pods to make a drink - these are not complementary and are charged for at a hefty rate! When I checked out, the surly Indian receptionist was very blunt when I queried the extras on my bill I hadnt consumed. No help was offered with my luggage and I had to struggle down an escalator with my baggage, again is this what a 5 star hotel offers? The location was lovely on the creek and the staff in the restaurant and in the lobby cafe were courteous but for me this hotel fell way short of 5 star for both service and comfort. Never again there are better hotels to be had than this in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton, Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Jrisnik
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the sheraton was nicer than we had hoped. The hotel is probably one of the oldest in the country, but nothing reflects it. The lobby area is quite lavish and the cafe on the ground floor is somewhere you can spend those hot afternoons for coffee. The rooms are quite nice and the view is excellent - Dubai creek and Bur Dubai. Despite being on the "main road" the hotel still can be used be vacationers and not only those visiting for business. Its extremely close to the creek, so easier to take those water taxis-abra to Bur and visit the Bastakiya. The staff is ok, nothing out of the ordinary, but we didnt interact too much to be able to give an opinion on them. Overall its a nice place to stay in dubai and we recommend bargaining with the hotel directly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Blackcountrybaggie
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a special treat on my wifes birthday, we had a great time the lady on the desk gave us an upgraded creek view room and had a birthday cake sent to our room compliments of the hotel. The Chelsea english pub inside the hotel was very good, The outside of the hotel is not as stunning as many of the hotels in Dubai due to its age, but the inside is awesome. Great value hotel ,its worth requesting a creek view room as its so relaxing watching the illuminated boats go by at night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: flyingdutchman06
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in the hotel - awesome. My room was big, and I took the 'special package', which included free access to the lounge (including wireless internet use), a creek view room, transport to the airport (in a Porche Cayenne, no less) and breakfast. Since my flight would leave early in the morning (before the breakfast lounge was open), I got to have breakfast in my room with no additional charge. The hotel boasts a couple of really good restaurants: the sushi I had in the Japanese restaurant is hands down the best I have had outside of Japan. The Indian restaurant was also extremely good - these restaurants merit a trip to this hotel even if you won't stay there. Unfortunately, I was not able to get a massage in the spa, since it was fully booked. The price tag is a little hefty, but I'd certainly recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on Dubai Creek”
Reviews.Author: foulaman
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at this hotel over Christmas and enjoyed it thoroughly. Good location within walking distance of the Gold Souk and a short walk along the waterfront to the waterbus over to Dubai Museum and the old quarter. Taxis to the other main sights in Dubai (e.g. Dubai Mall, Mall of the Emirates) were inexpensive. We spent an hour in a traffic jam and the metre barely budged. Our two rooms were in the Tower and included an excellent breakfast buffet in the executive lounge on the main floor plus free drinks before dinner. We ate one night in the Italian restaurant and had good food and service for a reasonable price. We also ate in the English Pub on the main level but found the food of inferior quality and the drinks over-priced. A bottle of water was almost the same price as the beer. Rooms were large, clean and well appointed, and price very reasonable by Dubai standards. The hotel was quiet over the holidays and our rooms were upgraded to suites, with complimentary fruit basket and bottle of wine. Personnel throughout the hotel were efficient and courteous, especially the bellmen. Our rate also included pick up and drop off at the airport. We would definitely stay there on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “$32/day for Internet!”
Reviews.Author: V Traveler
Reviews.Content: I arrived for what was supposed to be a 3-night stay. Check in was easy with no wait, although the offset chairs at the check-in desks are a little awkward. I prefer an old-fashioned check-in desk. My travel companions were Starwood Gold using points for a free stay and they were upgraded to an upper-floor creek view. I am a normal level Starwood preferred guest and was not automatically upgraded, contrary to what other reviewers have said. I was given a first-floor room with a view over the front of the hotel. Nice room - good bathroom, great shower, comfy beds. However, the location was awful. I barely slept, with the noise of guests in the lobby, then what sounded like someone pounding rocks, then with the sound of vacuuming in the lobby for several hours - may have been normal cleaning, may have been special work? Anyway, stay away from first floor rooms overlooking the lobby if you want to sleep. My first morning I learned that I would have to fly home that evening due to a family emergency. The hotel was very accommodating and waived any fees for checking out early. They even gave me a complementary late checkout. I left luggage with the bellman for a few hours with no problems. Very easy to get cabs from the front. The internet, as others have noted, is ludicrously expensive. 120 AED a day, which is $32/day. There is no excuse for this - that's more than I pay for a month at home. Services in Dubai are expensive, but not that expensive - it costs the hotel nothing incrementally to have more guests logged on. Next time I am going to verify internet rates in advance and not stay anywhere that charges over $10-15/day. Gauging your customers on small things like internet (or mini-bar) is a good way not to get repeat business. So nice hotel - if they bring their internet charges back down to a reasonable level I would consider staying there again. And I would pay a little more for a creek view - anything but a 1st floor lobby-overlooking room would be better.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Creek Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Prady
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton Dubai Creek Hotel and Towers at the beginning of November. In summary the hotel stay was really nice and I would probably stay there again... We stay on the 9th floor in a Towers Room. In the room it tells you that the rate is 3200Dhs/night for a Towers Room and about Dhs850 for a normal room. The Towers room was massive, full size bed, LCD TV, DVD player, Hairdryer, Sofa and Armchair, Coffee machine (as part of minibar). The view out of the window was pretty amazing as well, as we had a room that overlooked the Creek. The bathroom is quite large, the shower is powerful, and the mirror is heated so it doesnt steam up! You also get access to the towers lounge, which is a large quite with a few sofas, single computer internet access, and a TV. Here you have access to complimentary coffee, tea and non-alcholic drinks. Canapes are served around tea time, and complimentary alcohol is served between 6.30-8pm. We got this at a discounted price, but I wouldn't have paid the full whack for it. Breakfast is served in the Towers Lounge (continental) or in the italian restaurant in the lobby (full range of items). The atmosphere downstairs is much better, and you have the option of seating on the terrace above the pool over looking the Creek. The Service of the staff is flawless. We had an early flight, and so the hotel had shifted our booking to pay for the extra early check, which I wasn't too happy about. However after a little bit of negotiating, we managed to have that waiived. (I was prepared to wait 5hrs in the lobby until the appropriate check in time). The person that stands out the most was the conceirge. He knew practically everything about where to go and what to do. Having a Towers reservation we were picked up from the airport in a Porsche Cayenne S... Quite a welcome to my first trip to Dubai. I didnt visit the gym, but the pool is nice, and was never too busy. Though some may find it small. The hotel interior is lovely, though I am told its is not as grand as some of the hotels further out of the city. The Lobby restaurant serves excellent food. The Abra crossings are about a 15min walk down the creek, and there is a stop for the air-con boat about 5mins walk away. There is also a Bank next door for cash withdrawals if you require. Location wise, the hotel is on the Deira side of the river, so is quick to travel to from the gold souk, though anywhere else on the otherside of the Creek requires the taxis to cross over one of the two bridges, which lengthens commutting time a fair bit. In a nutshell, really nice hotel, nice views, good location, awesome service!

Reviews.Title: “Not what it seems - smile politely, then walk away”
Reviews.Author: PuffinMarine
Reviews.Content: From before I arrived until the moment I left, this was a horror story, with one redeeming feature. let's get that out of the way right now - the room was fantastic; a Creek view in the Towers - if after reading all these reviews you decide to stay here, make sure you get Room 714! 1. Starwood offer a Best Price Guarantee, though I beat the rate quoted by the Hotel by 37%. To prove the rate, I had to make the booking, which then involved a 15% (First Day) cancellation fee. Starwood offered to match the rate I had paid and then beat it by 10% - which would of course have still cost me 5% overall. I asked if this discounted rate or % could be commuted to a future reservation in the same hotel and was told that it couldn't. So, don't trust Starwood's promises then... 2. Internet for 13 days was charged 3 times at AED700, which is what I pay for a year at home. That is the weekly rate - I was charged 3 times, but my stay was less that 2 weeks. Go figure! The internet connection is crushingly slow and the hotel are not interested in resolving it, even for AED2,100 (£400). 3. My room rate included breakfast and when I arrived there was a letter in the room advising that this could be selected from the Room Service menu. For the first 4 days this was fine, then on the 5th the Room Service guy told me that the policy had changed and I would have to eat in the restaurant. Fine, but why leave it to me to find out? Couldn't they manage expectations a bit better? 4. I confirm that a single Snickers or Choclolate bar costs AED32 (£6); so does a packet of chips, nuts, a can of Coke or a bottle of water. I expect Ice Cubes do too, but - as with all the other items - there is no price list and you only find out at checkout. 5. 12 black & white pages cost me AED95 (£18) to print out; forget either the in-house printMe service or emailing your document to the Business Centre - the internet connection is too slow and they deny ever receiving it. Get a memory stick and go down in person. 6. Huge farce sending a single page fax to Hong Kong - ended up having to dial it myself and having an argument with the Business Center staff about the number. For this privilege - AED35 (£6.75) 7. Don't expect any help with your bags after checkout; it's 50 metres to the door, and you will remember every one of them. Door staff surly and refuse to hail local cabs, only the retained limos. Traffic outside the hotel can be very congested. 8. Massage and Spa centre agreed a surprise package and schedule for my girlfriend face-to-face with me, then when she turned up for her surprise she was told they were busy, kept waiting for an hour and then turned away and told to come back the next day. She didn't. 9. I shouldn't complain about the complimentary fruit bowl, as it was free. I'll therefore just mention that the strawberries had mould on them, and I took them down to reception to prove it. 10. Multiple local phone calls charged on my bill; very cheap, but I didn't actually make any local calls. Don't know what was going on there. Conclusion - rubbish and way too much top notch competition in the immediate area (Hilton, Radisson SAS etc) - and I will certainly never stay there again. Oddly, the far cheaper 4 star Four Points by Sheraton in Bur Dubai is much nicer, if apparently less splendid.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: GGBPhil
Reviews.Content: Sheraton may be a bit away from the main action but it's a cozy place to stay. The concierge and the business center staff were very accommodating and pro-active. And, it's always great to see our Filipino compatriots there, as gracious as ever.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic customer service”
Reviews.Author: florida7718
Reviews.Content: In June 2008 my wife and I selected the Sheraton Dubai Creek to celebrate our silver wedding anniversary. We booked through what we thought was a reputable website. Unfortunately, unbeknown to us the website cancelled our booking at the Sheraton and transferred it to a far inferior 2* hotel. Fortunately, the Sheraton reservations department alerted us to this and after about 6 weeks of hassle we were assured by the web comapny it had been sorted out. The day we travelled an alert member of the Sheraton reservations department e-mailed us to say the web company had cancelled our last night's stay. On our arrival at the Sheraton we were upgraded to a beautful room overlooking Dubai Creek. The receptionist and reservation staff spent 4 days trying to resolve our last night's stay with our travel agent. Thanks to the hard work and persistence of Miss Maleeha and Miss Honeylet they resolved our problem and made our stay a most memorable one. The hotel is a true 5* experience situated in a perfect location to discover Dubai. The breakfast was outstanding, you could eat outside on the luxurious terrace overlooking the Creek or inside. We had our last evening meal at the hotel's Ashiana restaurant voted the best Indian restaurant in Dubai by Time Out magazine. It was one of the best 'Indian's' I have ever had at a reasonable cost. The hotel management was attentive, without being overly intrusive, to ensure our stay was perfect. The celebration cake left in our room on the first night was a lovely surprise and tasted delicious. Thank you to all at the Sheraton and we would be very happy to recommend your hotel. P.S. I recommend a trip to Al Mamzar Beach Park...far better than Jumeirah Beach Park.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect to see the real Dubai”
Reviews.Author: fellsausguy
Reviews.Content: Like many others, I spent about 6 weeks agonising over different reviews and trying to work out what to do: stay in the city, stay at the beach, etc. I couldn't have been happier with my decision. The hotel was a good 5-star hotel standard that you'd expect from any major city. Top quality without the mega-luxury you'd pay three times for. If you want to lay in the sun all day and spend a tonne on room service (and do nothing much else), then stay at the big resorts near the beach. However you can lay in the sun anywhere (and in much cheaper resorts with better beaches!). I recommend staying at this hotel and then you're only a stroll from the creek (creek is an understatement), the souks, the musuem, the river cruises and the open top bus tours (5 mins away). Although don't expect everything at your immediate doorstep - I'm a happy walker and all the above was within a 5-20 minute walk. I went past the beach front resorts on the bus tour and they seemed to be out in the middle of nowhere - you'd have to get a cab to go anywhere. Not my idea of a cultural experience! But each to their own. I was disappointed with the shopping malls - they're just shopping malls! Go to the souks and museum instead. Also highly recommend making a dinner reservation at the italian restaurant in the hotel - just remember to ask for a table on the non-smoking balcony. The breakfast was brilliant. The english style pub was a little disappointing - better to get room service! The hotel was very accommodating with my early arrival time too - they let me sleep out on a sun lounge near the pool (which was also very nice btw) for a little while, and then I ended up getting checked in early by about 1030am. Even got upgraded to a club room on the corner which was awesome. I wouldn't stay anywhere else if I went back. PS - yes, it is worth it to pay extra for a creek view room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Alicia_Vince
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights - and you really couldn't ask for more. Our room was on the 5th floor and was clean with a great view over the creek (make sure you request a creek view room). Traffic is crazy where ever you are in Dubai but we never had any problem getting a taxi - someone told us before we left that our hotel was far from the city but we found taxi's so cheap and didn't even notice an issue with distance - it was about 15mins from the mall of emirtaes. Breakfast was great - although my husband wasn't allowed in the breakfast restaurant with shorts on. Pool area was clean and we were the only people in the pool most of the time. Staff was very kind and friendly and a small tip goes a long way. I would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Beds, Wonderful Food”
Reviews.Author: jandm63
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights 4 & 5 September on way from NZ to Rome. Arrived early morning so had to wait a little to check-in. Decided to have breakfast, and once finished we were told our room was ready. Lovely hotel - fabulous breakfasts - highly recommended. Had the best Bento Box in The Lobby Cafe and a great meal and drinks at the Chelsea Arms. Beds were wonderfully comfortable and the creek view was great. Only thing we didn't get was the "fruit basket" promised in the advertising ... A handy walk to catch a boat to do a creek cruise. No construction noise at all which was a relief. Not too far from airport. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: endtry
Reviews.Content: this is a nice. Friendly staffs. Fantasy view.

Reviews.Title: “5 star luxury!”
Reviews.Author: ashmorayw
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Upgraded to the Towers Lounge package which gave us unlimited access to tea and coffee/snacks during the day plus alcoholic drinks for 2 hours a day. Also free internet access. The location is fine, taxis are cheap and getting one from the hotel is no problem. The Creek was nice for a stroll in the evening. We ate in the Italian and Indian restaurant in the hotel, both of which were excellent. Breakfast was an amazing spread in a lovely room overlooking the Creek. Weather far too hot in July - Dubai is best enjoyed when it is cooler. Recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love to be here, as always!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hands0meRob
Reviews.Content: I always choose this hotel because of the location and most of all the staff, which I've known some of them in the last 15 yrs. Although there are lots of brand new hotels in Dubai, but I still considered this place as my second home... The Restaurants are great. I've tried all the Indian restaurant in Dubai but Ashiana is still my favorite...

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sheraton and Thomas!”
Reviews.Author: vabelle77
Reviews.Content: I traveled with 3 other women last week, and stayed at the Sheraton Dubai Creek for 7 nights. I truly appreciated the kindness of everyone on staff, including Thomas, who as you can tell from his review responses, cares more about his hotel than any other manager I've ever seen. The rooms were lovely and clean, and the quality of the food in the hotel was not something I often see at hotels in the states. Our room was 107 and overlooked the creek, which had amazing views. I also loved all the gorgeous, unique flower arrangements around the hotel. I had 2 jet-lag massages while I was there, and they were wonderful and very well priced. For 80 minutes, it was about $90 which is a steal if you've priced other resort spas. The pool was wonderful, as the chairs are all padded lounge chairs and there's plenty of shaded areas to sit. The hotel also arranged for our Arabian Adventures tour, which was a real treat. We never had a problem getting a taxi, which are very inexpensive. The Sheraton is a short drive from just about every destination you'd wish to visit, but really you don't have to leave the hotel if you don't feel like it, as there are Italian, Indian, and Japanese restaurants, not to mention the pub, a pastry bar, and a mid-day mini-gourmet buffet in the lobby. I want to go back already! Thank you, Thomas for such a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “With all the choice in Dubai of Hotels, I would pass by this place”
Reviews.Author: seanbos
Reviews.Content: The location is a little poor with not much around the hotel, other then the creek. I found the staff very rude for this quality of a hotel. Room was clean. Pool area was okay. Overall I would rate it as a 4 star place based on location, room decor and services. but I will avoid this place in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Speedbox
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Dubai (what a great place!!) and my first stay with the Sheraton Dubai Creek. Firstly, don't be put off by the location of the hotel. Being in the city has many advantages, and regardless, taxis are plentiful and cheap (by Australian standards). Make sure that you book a room in the Tower section of the hotel, and pay (or beg) for a room that overlooks the Dubai creek. This is definitely worthwhile. The Sheraton Dubai Creek is a very comfortable 5 star hotel. It is not the newest hotel in Dubai but the rooms are clean, a reasonable size, and well maintained. We stayed for 6 nights and were always greeted by staff at the hotel by our names, and nothing was too much trouble. Hotel dining expenses are exactly what you would expect to pay for this class of hotel. The biggest decision facing somebody contemplating Dubai is whether to stay at the beach, or in the city. This decision can only be based on what you want from your holiday!! Jumeirah Beach is great, although somewhat isolated, but again, taxis are plentiful. Regardless, I think that Dubai now represents a genuine holiday destination, and is no longer merely a "stop-over". We had 7 great days, being a combination of activities and relaxation, and could have stayed longer. Must do's are : Wild Wadi; Desert Safari; Gold Souk; Mall of the Emirates; Dubai creek dinner cruise. Many comment about the ongoing building, and traffic, in Dubai. Yes, many areas are disrupted by building, but this is not "intrusive" to the point of annoyance. Indeed, you are witnessing the birth of a totally modern city that will be one of the world's great travel destinations. Secondly, traffic is heavy (particularly during rush hour) but if you avoid travelling in those peak times, the delays are minimal (common sense!). Ladies, your dress should be "conservative". Bikinis are fine at the beach/hotel pool, but not appreciated elsewhere. Longer dresses (about knee length) or jeans, and covered shoulders are the norm in shopping malls and on the street. The only disappointment was the Dubai Zoo. It was not to the 1st class level I expected of this outstanding city. In fact, I thought it was a bit sad. Nevertheless, Dubai offers a fantastic variety of activities, only limited by your time, and your wallet. Dubai, and the Sheraton Dubai Creek Hotel, are strongly recommended. Personally, I can't wait until "Dubai World" begins to open its' doors from 2010.

Reviews.Title: “good location but nothing else”
Reviews.Author: Fabhols
Reviews.Content: Before coming to stay at this hotel we had spent 5 nights at the royal meridien in jumeriah beach..it was a fantastic 5 star...coming to this hotel afterwards was a very big let down. Sheraton Dubai Creek good location but that is it. They gave us room 1101 WHICH NEEDS TO BE AVOIDED. For a 5 star hotel I thought it was a very big let down. The rooms are dated, and room 1101 I found was dirty, dated, had stains on the sofa, curtains and carpet, the balcony was dirty and for a no smoking floor the corridor wreaked of smoke. Very big dissappointment. Fantastic views of the creek but I would not bother with a Towers Room which I though was a complete waste. Ok you get a airport transfer, but that's about it. You get complimentary drinks all day which is good but they lounge is so small that you are practically sitting next to strangers, complimentary breakfast is a waste of time limited choice and continental - small selection. I would have prefered to save on the room rate and eat in the Vivaldi resturant for breakfast. Indian resturant was very nice. you get complimentary internet access but that is also a waste because there is only one computer so you have to hang about. Service was just ok.....not fast and they charge 5 dirhams each time you order room service. I have stayed at many 5* hotels and this has got to be the worst - room really spoilt our holiday especially when I paid £620.003 nights !! I will not be staying here again. It is a good location on the creek...so if that is going to be enough for you go for it..but otherwise I would go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “looking out over the creek”
Reviews.Author: Packhorse
Reviews.Content: We were very lucky - arriving 6 am and electing to pay the extra half day, we were upgraded to a top floor creek-view room. Magic. Airconditioning a bit inflexible but everything else faultless. Enjoyed high tea & English bar, too.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!!!”
Reviews.Author: Spidey_25
Reviews.Content: We booked via thru expedia and all I can say is that we had a wonderful experience at this hotel. Having a good location and beautiful view of the creek, all the staff performs an excellent service. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel nice place boot expensive city”
Reviews.Author: yorksSouthyorkshire
Reviews.Content: B4 booking to go to dubai, understand this u can not do Dubai on a budget at all, unless u are T total, love mc donalds,and love water parks we spent ££££ more than expected,lovely place but very expensive 4 the normal things u enjoy on holls. E.g Beer is between £5.00-£9.00 a pint for 3 orange juices and 3 sandwiches it was over £30.00 im not tight or poor but geess to me ridiculous, when u can buy 200 cigarettes for £6.00 or a taxi for an hour for less than £12 The hotel was wonderful- we stayed room only it was exceptionally clean excellent choice of tv chanels free morning news paper internet connection if required Exceptional gym, and shower areas, Pool ok wasnt the biggest pool, but was nice to have a quick dip My partner had a massage and said it was wonderful and very reasonably priced there are 3 resturants, a cake counter that sells the most beautiful looking cakes We ate in the Indian restaurant and it was beautiful, the wine is very expensive here, i think about £30 quid for cheapest bottle The chelsea arms pub, is great just like being at home lovely bar food, free nuts all night, but again the beer is expensive although they do have happy hours. couldnt fault the hotel at all, infact i am looking to go away again and would love it to be 1 of the shereton chain i was that impressed there

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: holidayjunkie76
Reviews.Content: From the moment I was picked up from the airport to the time I left Dubai I was treated to excellent hospitality from the staff of the Sheraton Dubai Creek and the locals (all spoke good english). I had a city creek view room and it was well worth it watching the dhow boats and other traffic go up and down Dubai Creek at all hours and a view of the city, Burj Dubai - the tallest building in the world(still under construction as well as most of Dubai) and other towers in the distance. The pool area wasn't too busy during the day so getting a seat was no problem. The gym was adequate as were the steam room and sauna in the change rooms. A good thing to note, staying at the Sheraton Dubai Creek means you can also use the facilities of the Sheraton Jumeirah Beach for a small fee of 75 dhs. A free shuttle bus takes you there from the hotel at 10.00 and returns from the Jumeirah Sheraton at 16.30. You can use all their facilities, beach, pool, gym and add bills to your own hotel room back at Dubai Creek. This is a cheaper alternative than staying there. The location of the hotel was good for getting around and picking up taxis. They are very cheap and ask for a local taxis as the hotel ones have meters too but they are more expensive and unlike local taxis, the fare goes up while you are waiting. So if you are stuck in traffic moving nowhere, the meter keeps going up. Food wise, there wasn't much around the hotel. However, the hotel has some good restuarants including Vivaldi (Italian) and a Japanese restuarant which is supposedly one of the best in Dubai. Not far, about 5 mins walk away is the Hilton Dubai Creek that has a Gordon Ramsay restaurant worth checking out. Also, you have the Deira City Centre, a shopping centre, just a short taxi ride (10 dhs) from the hotel with a large foodcourt and restaurants at very reasonable prices but don't plan on getting a taxi very quickly back to the hotel. Waits can be from 1 - 2 hours after 4pm. One night, my partner and I went to a restaurant at the Burj Al Arab which gave us entry into the 7* hotel. The skyview bar and the restaurant in the balIroom have views from the 27th floor while the others are near the ground floors. I would highly recommend this experience, wonderful views and service giving you an insight of how the very wealthy dine. To make sure you get a table I would book before you arrive as several of the restaurants were booked out for the whole month of April. The hotel location is also good for the big bus tour (175 dhs) as there is a stop (Stop 7) about 500m from the hotel towards the gold souk before the Radisson SAS. This gives you a good chance to see Dubai, their beaches and shopping malls as it stops at quite a few including the Mall of Emirates and Deira City Centre. The gold souk is a wonderful opportunity to test your haggling skills and also get you out of the heat into air conditioned comfort. Prices on items are just a guide. Remember the prices are heavily inflated and its a bit of fun to see how low you can get them. Aim for about 35 - 40% off the original price and if you don't get your price, don't worry, there are many more shops around and if they really want the sale they will chase you back to the store. Also, if you want to get any goods, electronics etc, don't get it from the airport as you will find the prices cheaper at the local shopping centres. A great excursion in the afternoon is a Desert Safari which includes 4x4 driving over sand dunes, camel and quad bike riding, bbq dinner at a Bedouin camp and a belly dancing performance. Prices can be from 150 - 375 dhs per person. The cheaper ones you get a bus out to the site while the more expensive ones pick you up and return you to the hotel in your own 4x4 or even a Hummer. The food is great, plentiful, the drive over the sand dunes is like a roller coaster. A great way to spend an evening. Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Sheraton Dubai Creek and Dubai and the great deal I got from DubaiResorts.com made the stay well worth it. I would recommend this hotel to all groups, family, business persons, honeymooners etc.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: globalskier100
Reviews.Content: Just over a wall from the bustling dhow wharfage of Dubai Creek, the Sheraton is an oasis of calm. We stayed there at the end of our trip to Oman and Dubai and it was perfectly relaxing. I can't recommend a Towers Creek View room enough, the extra cost is well worth it - you can slide open the glass doors and take in the sights and sounds of the river and watch the sun set over the skyscrapers in the distance. The room was all I expected of 5-star luxury, with lots of little extras to make our stay really special. The staff were all very friendly and nothing was too much trouble. The riverside location is also excellent, with the souqs, abra boat stops etc within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing holiday at the creek”
Reviews.Author: lincasanova
Reviews.Content: We just spent four nights at the sheraton creek hotel. since this was our first trip to dubai, we were hoping staying near the creek was a good idea, as so many people suggest the beach resorts. The staff was very helpful and pleasant. i I am a starwoods member but unfortunately was not upgraded. we had a city view room but we were not disappointed as i enjoyed checking out the traffic before i went downstairs everyday! we were offered a fruit plate to our room everyday free of charge. there was a coffee/tea service that was also free, but had a 5dhs ( 1 euro) delivery fee billed to the room. we were very happy with the location, as it allowed us to stroll at night along the dock, and also take the dhows or water taxi over to the "old" part, dubai museum, heritage village and textile souks. our return trip to the airport on a friday night at 10.30 pm took about 10 minutes and cost 3 euros (15dhs)!! as mentioned, watching the water traffic was especially entertaining during dinner and breakfast on the covered terrace. the breakfast buffet was very well presented and tasty. there is a chef making eggs and the staff is very attentive throughout the entire hotel. The menu prices were some of the most reasonable of the MANY restaurants we tried. The quality was excellent. Reserve the terrace in advance as outside dining fills up quickly. However, the view from most tables inside is also good. we were allowed to use the health club and pool while waiting for our room, and also the last evening, as our return flight left at 1.30 a.m., we had a steam bath and shower before our long flight home. The area around the sheraton is totally built up so we experienced no construction noise whatsoever. The National Bank of Dubai is next door with a drive through ATM you can use anytime, which is convenient. The building next to that is a government building which has a public cafeteria that makes the most delicious fruit drinks/dishes. The most important thing is to organize your outings in a logical sequence, since, no matter where you are staying, you do not want to be criss- crossing with the horrendous traffic you find on most roads and especially at certain times of day. Golfers wanting to play Dubai Creek Golf Club will be happy with the short ride (5 minutes). This club also has SEVERAL fabulous restaurants. we thouroughly enjoyed our stay here, although it is not a jaw-droppng experience like you find up at the top beach resorts, but we didn´t feel spending more than double or triple what we were paying here was worth the difference for the type of vacation we are used to taking.

Reviews.Title: “A very good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LiaSlappendel
Reviews.Content: Last Summer we went to Dubai and stayed in Sheraton Dubai Creek and Towers. We had a great view at the Creek because we upgraded the room to a Tower Room and it was excellent. Especially the Tower lounge,where they served nice food and had happy hour every day. With delicious Chardonnay. The pool was not that big, but big enough because there were not a lot of people in it. The staff was very friendly and helpfull. The location was also great. There is a shuttle-service which takes you to Sheraton Jumeirah and to the airport. When we go back to Dubai, we will stay in this hotel again. Lia Slappendel Holland

Reviews.Title: “Good value (for Dubai)”
Reviews.Author: HK79
Reviews.Content: In a city of exceptionally expensive hotels, the Sheraton Dubai Creek Hotel & Towers offers decent value for five star accommodation. The hotel room was clean and comfortable. A room with a view of the Creek, towards the new city is very pleasant. The hotel facilities (gym and pool) were of a high standard. Hotel food was excellent. The service was excellent in parts (front desk, restaurants, concierge) and shocking in others ("Towers" lounge). The hotel location is mixed - it really depends what you want to do. If you're a tourist, it's OK but expect to give yourself an hour to get to Mall of the Emirates, Burj Al Arab, Madinat, Jumeirah Beach Hotel etc. If you're on business, the location is a bit of a pain - give yourself a good 30 minutes to get to Jumeirah Emirates Towers or DIFC. It's a good location for the airport (15 minutes), the Gold Souk, and Burj Dubai. It's pretty easy to get a taxi, and the folks at the hotel are more than happy to provide you with detailed directions if you want to catch a boat somewhere (at the rear of the hotel). A few other points about this hotel: 1. I noticed that the hotel website makes a distinction between standard rooms and "towers" rooms. I was always under the impression that a "towers" room was something special. However, when I arrived at the hotel I discovered that almost all rooms are "towers" rooms. A bit of marketing puffery, I think! 2. The hotel tries to sting you real bad for trying to check-in early - watch out! In my case, they did allow me to check out at 3PM, and store my luggage, and use the health club to shower before taking a late flight. 3. If you do check-out, dont try to go into the "towers" lounge, they attempt to charge you for having a drink and a piece of fruit. 4. The hotel booking process was very annoying - five emails to get a "towers" room with two beds and early check-in! Overall, I think the hotel offers good value but I would try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: fisydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights on our first visit to Dubai. The hotel was very flash and luxurious and the staff were all so helpful and polite it made our stay perfect. We ate at one of the hotel restaurants,the food and service were great and it was reasonably priced. We would definately stay there again if we go back to Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but location not so good”
Reviews.Author: LondonA_s
