Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Towers Room for 4 nights last week. Hotel is great and the rooms are very spacious. The hotel is only 10 mins from the airport and the taxi cost us about 40 Dhirams. However, if I went back to Dubai I would not stay here again because of the hotel's location. I would stay in the Jumeriah area. Jumeriah beach and hotels, Burj al Arab, Mall of the Emirates, Ibn Battutta mall are all far and it takes 30 mins in a taxi. We did this taxi ride in traffic everyday. The traffic in Dubai is really bad. The hotel is convenient for the gold souk, the creek, City Centre Mall and airport. The only problem I had was the location. Well just a small point - no team and coffee making facilities in the towers rooms. You can order comp tea and coffee but there is a 5 dh charge. The Chelsea Arms pub shows English premiership football.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible staff - miserable hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: SimonDubai
Reviews.Content: what a miserable exeperience we had the other day...for a 5 star hotel, the way you are treated is with complete indifference with no sense of care and attention. After being refused a taxi at the entrance (as we weren't staying there but friends were) I asked to speak to the duty manager and was treated with utter contempt -.....how this place can call itself a luxury hotel is beyond me...normally Dubai is very good for service but this place somehow manages to be the worst example I have come across in the 3 years I have been in the city...avoid it if you can !

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ghrrd
Reviews.Content: I was been in this hotel on the beginning of january . Once i arrived at the airport I found a Cayenne that picked me up to carry me at the hotel , arrived there I had a quickly check-in . As i saw the room i was surprised on how big it was and about the wonderfull view we had on the creek Next morning we had our first breakfast at the hotel and let me to tell you it was really nice , a lot of pretty recipes accompanied with a delightfull service . During the day great selection for snack on afternoon and aperitiv on the evening , all of this was free for a Tower room . We also tried the japanese buffet that offered a lot of beautiful recipe and really warm service for a cheap price , I never found that kind of quality neither at a half of price . Swimming pool is small but cute and in five days i had so much things to do and view that i hadn't the chance to try it . Every day i could appreciate breakfast , afternoon snack and aperitiv but only the last day i had a little time for the gym where i only went to the sauna To resume my overview of the hotel i only have to say that it was a wonderfull experience for me and my wife and I surely recomend it to my friend

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but beware”
Reviews.Author: chestnutcottage
Reviews.Content: After booking a 3 day stopover in a Dubai 4 star hotel, travel agent came back with an unsolicited irrestible offer from Sheraton. I accepted the Sheraton offer and paid in advance. On arrival at hotel, Sheraton declined the agents voucher and demanded rack rate for 3 days. After a lot of argument Sheraton agreed to something less, but more than was covered for by the travel agent's voucher. Stay coincided with Ramadan. Was not surprised to find there were constraints about eating & drinking in public view. Did not like early closure of swimming pool in order for staff to prepare pool area for evening banquets. One gained the impression that Sheraton was motivated by commercial advantage rather than taking proper account of religious sensibilities. In all other respects the hotel was satisfactory & staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine”
Reviews.Author: Sarahbeac1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights just on a stop over after week long holiday in Africa. Having read the reviews we really didn’t know what to expect but overall the hotel was fine. We arrived at 0800 and, as expected, were told check-in time was 1500 but to come back at 1300. We were not even offered the room early for a price but were told we could use the facilities of the heath club and pool while we waited. We had breakfast in The Lobby cafe before taking a taxi to the Mall of the Emirates to kill some time. We arrived back at the hotel about 1330 and were given our room straight away. We had booked a classic city view room and were upgraded to a creek view “executive” mini suite which was a nice surprise. The views of the creek were amazing, especially at night. Breakfast in the Vivaldi restaurant was also amazing. Everything you could possibly imagine and the first morning were lucky enough to get an outside terrace table (overlooking the creek). We had dinner the second night in the Vivaldi restaurant and it was fabulous. Again we had a terrace table. The food was wonderful and very reasonable priced. We had two seafood starters, two pasta main courses, two desserts, two soft drinks and a glass of wine all for the equivilant of GBP 55. You would pay that in the UK for a mediocre Italian meal for two where as this was truly something special. Our view on the hotel staff members was that they were “courteous” but not “friendly”. Maybe this is down to the fact it is a predominantly business hotel. We would probably return if the price was right and would recommend the hotel to friends who wanted to stay by the creek.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Phoolan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely fabulous and is in a great location. The room was brilliant: very comfortable and spacious and had all the amenities necessary. The staff were brilliant and always happy to help with anything. The hotel had some amazing restaurants and the buffet breakfast in the Vivaldi restaurant was great. They had so many varieties of food - something for everyone and a huge variety of fresh juices were also available. The chefs would cook you anything you wanted and the service was impeccable. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to go there for business or just to relax. All the staff were absolutely brilliant.
